title: wahoo_kai_(kancolle)
body:
The upgraded form of [[Wahoo (Kancolle)|]].

Visual changes include [[Japanese flag]] [[kill markings]] on the part of Wahoo's white scarf wrapped around her neck, and the words "Shoot the Sunza Bitches" on the part of the scarf trailing away from her. A full-sized [[Oerlikon 20mm Gun]] is also added to Wahoo's arsenal, with a red-colored [[gun sling]] holding it over Wahoo's shoulder, separate from her other rigging.

title: heinkel_wolfe
body:
[[Hellsing]] character. A member of Iscariot working directly under [[Alexander Anderson]], and typically partnered with [[Takagi Yumie|Yumiko Takagi]]. She is a [[tomboy]] with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] wearing a [[crossdressing|male priest's uniform]]. She fights with two [[handgun|pistols]] and is typically seen smoking a [[cigarette]].
[spoilers]After being shot in the cheek by [[captain (hellsing)|the Captain]], she has a [[Glasgow smile]] and [[bandaged head]], though her mouth and eyes remain uncovered.[/spoilers]
other_names: ハインケル・ウーフー

title: wahoo_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the US submarine USS [i]Wahoo[/i] (SS-238), drawn by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]]. 

Wahoo is depicted with either light [[brown hair]] or [[grey hair]] and [[grey eyes]], a [[hair ornament]] with her hull number "238", and [[red gloves|red]] and [[blue gloves|blue]] [[partially fingerless gloves]] on her hands. Like her sisters, Wahoo wears a [[two-tone]] black and white high-leg [[competition swimsuit]] with black [[rudder footwear]], though Wahoo personalizes with a [[white scarf]] and an [[American flag print]] [[denim]] [[miniskirt]]. Her base form carries only the same [[torpedo launcher]] [[rigging]] as her sisters.

Wahoo's Kai form, however, gains additional touches as a nod to her status as one of the most successful submarines of the Pacific War. She slings an [[Oerlikon 20mm Gun]] behind her rigging, and decorates her scarf with [[Japanese flag]] [[kill markings]] and the words, "Shoot the [[profanity|Sunza Bitches]]".

h4. Appearance
* !post #8961300: Base
* !post #8961304: [[Wahoo Kai (Kancolle)|Kai]]

h4. [i]Gato[/i]-class submarines
* [[Drum (kancolle)|]] (SS-228)
* [b]Wahoo[/b] (SS-238)
* [[Scamp (kancolle)|]] (SS-277)

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Wahoo[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Wahoo_(SS-238)]

title: mauser_c96
body:
A semi-automatic [[handgun]] made by German arms manufacturer Mauser from 1896 to 1937. It used an integral box magazine in front of the trigger loaded by [[clip (weapon)|stripper clips]] and had a distinctive "broomhandle" style grip that could be used with a detachable [[shoulder stock]]. Originally chambered for the 7.63×25mm Mauser, while later and foreign variants were available in 9mm Parabellum, .45 ACP and more.

This tag also applies to its selective fire variant, the later [b]M-712 [i]Schnellfeuer[/i][/b] with higher-capacity [[magazine (weapon)|removable magazines]].

* !post #6008144

h4. See also

* [[Borchardt C-93]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[C96 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mauser C96":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mauser_C96

title: ehoumaki
body:
[b]Ehoumaki[/b] (恵方巻き, lit. "[[ehou|Lucky-Direction]] [[Makizushi]]") refers to the custom in the Kansai region of eating a [i]futomaki[/i] (a type of [[sushi]]) on the evening of [[Setsubun]] (February 3rd) while facing "Ehou" (the lucky direction that changes according to the year) or to the [[makizushi]] itself. Much like [[Valentine]]'s Day chocolate, it is almost a man-made custom spread by promotional activities of concerned bodies for reasons purely related to profit and sales.

In the 1970s, it spread through the Kansai region thanks to [[nori (seaweed)|nori]] distributors/wholesalers and [[sushi]] shops, and in the 2000s, it spread throughout Japan thanks to the [[convenience store]] industry. In other words, this custom is very new to places outside of Kansai.

h4. See also

* [[swiss roll]] (Recently, roll cakes are being sold as opportunistic products on Setsubun.)
* [[Setsubun]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* [[Tag Group:Holidays and Celebrations]]

title: suzumori_asuka
body:
A major character in [[Sounan Desuka?]]. Asuka is a cheerful and energetic student athlete on the basketball club, but also the most careless in a survival situation.

Asuka has [[short hair|short]] [[messy_hair|messy]] [[brown hair]] with [[sidelocks]], [[swept bangs]] and an [[ahoge]], has either [[purple eyes|purple]] or [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

Asuka wears a standard [[serafuku]] with a [[white shirt]] with a [[red ribbon]] under a brown [[sweater vest]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[kneehighs]].  She also wears [[white panties]] with a bunny on them and a simple [[white bra]].

Voiced by [[Kouno Hiyori]].

title: fetal_movement
body: Fetal movement, often referred to as quickening, refers to the movements of a fetus (unborn baby) felt by the pregnant woman. These movements are a sign that the fetus is developing and is a vital part of monitoring fetal health. Feeling baby move can be a sign of good health and well-being.

title: twitching
body:
Motions that are sudden, involuntary, sharp movements in response to agitation or stimulation. See [[flinch]] for similar motions in response to surprise or shock.

Use for momentary motions, not for sustained motions like shivering or [[trembling]].

Usually denoted by jagged [[motion lines]] or the moving body part having a jagged outline. May be [[animated]] without these techniques.

For the website, see [[twitch.tv|Twitch]].

h4. Specific Tags

* [[twitching bulge]]
* [[twitching penis]]
* [[twitching pussy]]
* [[twitching testicles]]

h4. See also
* [[flinch]]
* [[shaking]]
* [[trembling]]

h4. External Definition

"The Free Dictionary":[https://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/twitch]

In his original Luxiem attire, he wears a [[turtleneck]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt]] covered with a [[white jacket]] and a [[blue capelet|blue]] and [[white capelet]] on his top half. On the bottom half he wears a [[white pants]] with a [[suspenders]] and a [[brown belt]] on. He wears a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]], a [[blue scarf]] around his neck, a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[fishnet gloves]] on his hands and a pair of [[hoop earrings]] on his ears. He also has a [[book]] attached to a [[pouch]] strap.

body:
A pointed, crown-like symbol drawn next to a character's head to represent [[surprised|surprise]], understanding or shock.  Depending on the style, it may have the appearance of a [[crown]], a series of hash marks or some variation thereof. Usually there are three points, though there is some variation. 

Not to be confused with [[notice lines]], which look more like three lines pointing outward: [code]\|/[/code].

h4. Examples

* !post #8810063: wavy [[motion lines]] portraying [[trembling]]

title: kume_(touhou)
body: One of [[Ibaraki Kasen]]'s pet birds and her secondary means of transport, first seen in her manga [[Wild and Horned Hermit]]. She is a massive dapeng (commonly known as a roc in western myth), a giant sea eagle cryptid, able to carry her master's weight and at least one other passenger. Not to be confused with [[Kanda (touhou)|]], Kasen's other pet eagle, who is much more normal in size.

title: sendai_hakurei_no_miko
body:
先代博麗の巫女 ([i]Sendai Hakurei no Miko[/i], "The previous generation's Hakurei shrine maiden")

This tag is a catch-all for various [[Touhou]] [[Original]] Characters depicted as [[hakurei_reimu|Reimu]]'s predecessor. The [[sendai_hakurei_no_miko_(m.u.g.e.n)|most famous version]] and original source of the name being a fanmade [[M.U.G.E.N]] character by MUGEN author Pre-to.

She is usually depicted as Reimu's mother, though as a fan character her relation to Reimu on the Hakurei family tree can change with each depiction.

A very popular fanwork featuring [[sendai_hakurei_no_miko_(osana_reimu)|another version]] of this character is [[Osana Reimu]] and its sequel [[Reireimu]], a story about Sendai Miko, a young Reimu, and an [[EX-Rumia|adult]] [[Rumia]].

She is not the canon character revealed at the end of [[Foul Detective Satori]]. For that character, use the tag [[Gensokyo's First Hakurei Miko]].

title: zashiki-warashi
body:
From Obakemono:

"A household spirit resembling a child of either gender from about three to twelve years of age. The name zashiki-warashi comes from the interior of Iwate Prefecture, but similar legends are found all over Japan. It is often said that when this being dwells in a house, its family will be prosperous, but when it leaves, the house will fall into ruin, and also that the zashiki-warashi is never seen, save for just as it is about to leave. Its presence however, is often marked by the mischief it does to sleeping people, such as moving pillows about and pulling on bedding."

h4. External links

* http://www.obakemono.com/obake/zashikiwarashi/

title: otoroshi
body:
"Children's [[traditional youkai]] books often describe the otoroshi as dwelling on top of the gates to temples and shrines, waiting for impious and evil-intentioned people to pass below so that it may pounce upon them. This behavior seems to stem from a fictional account in Yamada Norio's 1974 book Tōhoku Kaidan no Tabi, and was likely inspired by Toriyama Sekien's depiction of the beast perched atop a torii gate with a bird in its claw." [1] 

h4. External links

* [1] http://www.obakemono.com/obake/otoroshi/ 
* "Wikipedia (Japanese)":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/おとろし

title: nuribotoke
body:
"The Nuribotoke is an animated corpse with darkened skin and dangling eyeballs in Japanese mythology. They are portrayed as similar in appearance to the Buddha but with largely bloated stomachs and occasionally having a catfish's tail. They are believed to have revived due to poor care of the household shrine. However due to interpretations that they possess a tail, it may be that the corpse is controlled by another being or be a [[traditional youkai]] in disguise. It will act like a messenger of the Buddha but give out false prophecies to fool worshipers. It is also believed to dance often, more so during the demons' night parade (Hyakki Yakō)." [1]

h4. External links

* [1] "Wikipedia (English)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuppepp%C5%8D
* "Wikipedia (Japanese)":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A1%97%E4%BB%8F

title: brand_of_sacrifice
body: The Brand of Sacrifice is the symbol of the Godhand in [[Berserk]], and marks those chosen to be sacrificed. The Brand acts as a beacon for ravenous demons who want to eat the bearer alive, and it bleeds and causes pain whenever they draw near. [[Guts (berserk)|]] has his Brand on the back of his neck, while [[Casca (berserk)|]] has hers on her left breast. The two are the only known characters of the series to have survived being branded.

title: nuppefuhofu
body:
ぬっぺふほふ  (also ぬっぺっぽう) 
A nuppefuhofu (also nuppeppou) is "a [[traditional youkai]] that is genderless and estimated to be up to 1.5m in height. It is described to have a flabby appearance and its appearance is accompanied by a pungent body odor. It appears as a blob of flesh with a hint of a face in the folds of fat. It is also described as having fingers and toes that are vaguely defined lumps. 

"The Nuppeppō is passive and unaggressive. The body odor is said to rival that smell of rotting flesh. Other theories claim that the Nuppeppō is actually decaying flesh. There is a rumor that states that those who eat the flesh of a Nuppeppō shall have eternal youth." [1]


h4. External links

* [1] "Wikipedia (English)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuppepp%C5%8D 
* "Wikipedia (Japanese)":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%AC%E3%81%A3%E3%81%BA%E3%81%B5%E3%81%BB%E3%81%B5

title: mokumokuren
body:
"Mokumokuren are spirits that live in torn [[shouji]] (Japanese paper sliding walls). If the shouji has many holes, eyes can sometimes be seen on it, which, if looked at long enough, can make people blind. The only way to remove the spirit from the wall is to patch up the holes in it." [1]


h4. See also

* [[traditional youkai]]


h4. External links

* [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mokumokuren

title: ittan_momen
body:
From "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ittan-momen :

"Ittan-momen (一反木綿 'one bolt(tan) of cotton'?) is a [[Tsukumogami]] formed from a roll of cotton in Japanese myth. Most has been handed down to the Kagoshima Osumi district. The Ittan-momen 'flies through the air at night' and 'attacks humans, often by wrapping around their faces to smother them.'"

title: fritz_rumey_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the planned German Atlantic Large Cruiser Carrier (Grossflugzeugkreuzer) Project II, Fritz Rumey is a hybrid ship that combines features of a large cruiser and an aircraft carrier, she is equipped with battleship-caliber guns, the size of a large cruiser and a flight deck of an aircraft carrier, combined both air power and firepower within.

Her design may be inspired from Hildebrand from [[World of Warships]]. Hildebrand is an O-class Large Cruiser that shares design from the Grossflugzeugkreuzer Projekt.

title: miwa_shirow
body:
Male Japanese mangaka and illustrator. He created the manga [[DOGS: Bullets & Carnage]] which has been turned into an anime OVA and also did the artwork for [[7th Dragon 2020]]. He also illustrated the official artwork for the video game series [[No More Heroes]] and [[Puzzle & Dragons]] (designing [[Sakuya (p&d)|]] and Sandalphon), as well as guest artwork for [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. He also is one of the illustrators for [[supercell (band)|]]. He likes drawing fanart for various other works, Japanese and Western alike. title: howto:pixiv
body:
"Pixiv":[https://www.pixiv.net] is a website where Japanese artists upload their artwork. It's one of the main sources of images on Danbooru.

h4. Uploading

Paste the link to the Pixiv post on the "upload page":[/uploads/new]. Don't download the image to your computer then upload it. Pasting a link avoids uploading a [[Pixiv sample]].

h4. Artist tags

If the artist doesn't already have a tag, then you'll need to make one. To create a new artist tag, tag the post with [code]artist:tag_name[/code].

The tag name should normally be their Pixiv display name in romanized form. See [[howto:romanize]] or ask in topic #8199 if you need help coming up with a tag name.

After you make a new artist tag, click the '?' next to the tag in the tag list to create a new artist entry. In the artist entry, add:

* The artist's Pixiv URL (e.g. https://www.pixiv.net/users/1007080)
* The artist's name (found under their profile picture).
* Any other names or URLs listed in their profile.

See [[help:artists]] for more information about making artist tags.

h4. Searching

When searching by tag, Pixiv has a limit of 1000 pages for results. To bypass this limit, add [b]?ecd=YYYY-MM-DD[/b] to the end of the URL:

* https://www.pixiv.net/en/tags/ガールズ%26パンツァー/artworks?ecd=2016-06-08

h4. See also

* [[pixiv sample]]
* [[bad pixiv id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]
* [[ugoira]]

title: artist_request
body:
A request for the artist of a post.

Do not use this tag if there is a source available, such as the artist's homepage, blog, Pixiv, etc. Read [[Help:Artists]] and create a new artist tag yourself, or ask for help in topic #8199: Artist tagging help.

It might be possible to find the artist with the help of a Reverse Image Search engine (see [[Help:Image source]]).

h4. See also

* [[source request]]
* [[tagme]]

title: howto:wiki
body:
The Danbooru Wiki exists to provide information about topics relevant to the site. Primarily, wiki entries are used to explain the usage of the various tags given to posts. In addition, the wiki allows us to construct useful informational resources such as tag lists, tag groups, and "How To" pages such as the one you are currently viewing. 

This page will give you an idea of how to properly construct or edit an entry in the Danbooru Wiki, as well as some warnings regarding what conduct is unacceptable. As with all things, if you have further questions about the material presented here, you may ask a staff member or contributor for help. Most of us are glad to help you. 

If you accidentally create a non-relevant wiki page, you may delete it by clicking "Edit" and then clicking "Delete".

h4. Formatting

All wiki pages are formatted using "DText":/static/dtext_help.

h4. Style

Use "h4." for headers and "h5." for subheaders. Character names should be written in the same order as their corresponding tag.

h4. Images
Images can be added to wiki pages. For more information on images, see topic #26714.

To add a group of thumbnail images, write this:
[code]
* !post #1
* !post #2
* !post #3
[/code]
To add captions beneath the images, write this:
[code]
* !post #1: This is a caption.
* !post #2: Here's another caption.
* !post #3: Captions can contain links, like this: [[Touhou]].
[/code]
To add a single large image to a wiki (do this only for things like screenshots in help wikis, not tag wikis), write this:
[code]
!post #1
[/code]
To add an arbitrary image that isn't from a post, first upload it, then find it on the Media Assets page, then write this:
[code]
* !asset #19734342: [[Ford Mustang II]] (1973-1978)
[/code]

h4. Guidelines

h5. What NOT to do:

* [b]No spoilers.[/b] The wiki is not the place to give away plot information. If spoilers are [i]absolutely necessary[/i] in order to describe the basis of a [[meme]] or other tag, it [b]MUST[/b] be marked properly [code][spoiler][/code] like this [code][/spoiler][/code] to make it [spoilers]like this[/spoilers].
* [b]Do not make entries for nonexistent tags[/b], except to mark a tag as [[list of disambiguation pages|ambiguous]] or [[tag group:subjective|subjective]]. Do not make entries for characters or copyrights that don't have any posts. Do not make vanity entries for yourself or for other users. There are some exceptions for rules articles such as this one, or explanatory categories such as [[tag_groups]].
* [b]Do not be subjective or biased.[/b] Wikis should be purely objective. Your personal feelings on the issue do not belong. Do not use words like "stupid", "sexy", "annoying", or "awesome".
* [b]Do not create wiki entries without a proper understanding of the tag and its correct usage.[/b] A misleading wiki giving incorrect information to users does not help the site in any way.

h5. What to do:

* [b]Be concise.[/b] Provide only the basic information that someone unfamiliar with the subject needs to know. As a rule of thumb, avoid going beyond one to two short paragraphs. If possible, especially regarding characters and copyrights, provide a link to an outside website with further information for the benefit of those interested.
* [b]Be relevant.[/b] Only include information that is relevant to Danbooru. The main purpose of a wiki entry is to explain how a tag is used, not to list everything you know about the topic.
* [b]Use images that are as safe-for-work as possible.[/b] Blacklists currently don't apply to embedded images, so they should be safe for everybody. For NSFW wikis, at least choose images that are tasteful. 
* [b]Link to other wiki entries.[/b] When you mention another tag, don't forget to link to that tag's wiki entry.
* [b]List other relevant links.[/b] Put links to any other relevant tags or outside websites in a "[b]See also[/b]" section at the bottom of the entry.

h5. Character wiki guidelines:

* [b]List the copyright.[/b] Don't forget to mention which copyright the character is from.
* [b]Describe the character's appearance.[/b] Be descriptive enough that someone unfamiliar with the character will be able to recognize and tag that character.
* [b]List the character's name in kanji/kana.[/b] This is helpful for translators.
* [b]Use correct naming conventions.[/b] Characters are tagged in the way they are written in their native languages, thus [[kinomoto_sakura|Kinomoto Sakura]], not Sakura Kinomoto. This "original order" policy carries over from tagging into wiki writing as well as translation notes.
* [b]List other relevant tags.[/b] Be sure to list any other tags that relate to the character. These may include alternate versions of the character, [[genderswap|genderswaps]], [[parody|parodies]], and so on.

h5. Copyright wiki guidelines:

* [b]Provide a brief synopsis.[/b] A short synopsis to provide some context is helpful, but [b]do not[/b] describe the plot in detail and [b]do not[/b] provide spoilers.
* [b]List related characters.[/b] List any characters that are involved in the copyright. Do not list characters that don't have any posts. 
* [b]List related copyrights.[/b] List any related sequels, prequels, or spin-offs.
* [b]Refer to series using the name Danbooru uses.[/b] For example, use [[hayate_no_gotoku!|Hayate no Gotoku!]] in a wiki, not Hayate the Combat Butler. It may be appropriate to mention alternate or translated titles, but use our tag as the primary. Don't italicize the name.

h5. Artist wiki guidelines:

* [b]Don't create unnecessary pages.[/b] For artist tags, there is the "artist library":/artist. See [[help:artists|how to use]].
* [b]Create pages without duplicating information.[/b] Sometimes it is required to specify additional information, then a wiki-page of the same name is created for the tag. Don't write a list of links and alternative names or nicknames. Use the artist library. 

h4. Go Back

* "Return to Wiki":/wiki_pages/help%3Atoc#dtext-wiki
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: howto:twitter
body:
"Twitter":[https://twitter.com] is where a growing number of Japanese artists publish their works. It's one of the main sources of images on Danbooru.

[b]Note:[/b] Japanese artists may refer to Twitter using the half-width ﾋ character, since it resembles how Twitter's logo used to look.

h4. Uploading

To upload from Twitter, paste a link to the tweet on the "upload page":[/uploads/new], like this:

* https://danbooru.donmai.us/uploads/new?url=https://twitter.com/weirdlilguys/status/1755223245614150080

Don't paste a direct link to the image, like this:

* https://danbooru.donmai.us/uploads/new?url=https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GFvOPQpW0AAR0A4.jpg

If you paste a direct link to the image, then Danbooru won't be able to find which tweet it belongs to, and won't be able to pull the artist, tags, and commentary.

h4. Image quality

Since December 11th, 2019, Twitter won't compress or downscale images unless the image is bigger than 4096x4096, more than 5MB large, or it has [[exif rotation]] or very inefficient compression ("[1]":[https://twitter.com/NolanOBrien/status/1204557498990002176], "[2]":[https://twitter.com/NolanOBrien/status/1204842518208057344]).

This means that Twitter uploads usually have the same quality as Pixiv uploads.

Images posted before December 11th, 2019 were always compressed or downscaled (except for PNG with alpha channel), so Twitter images from this time period were generally lower quality than Pixiv images.

h4. Artists

When making an artist entry, add both the username and user ID profile URLs, like this:

* http://twitter.com/GK0322
* http://twitter.com/intent/user?user_id=12345678

Danbooru will usually fill in both URLs automatically when making a new artist entry. If if doesn't, then you can use https://tweeterid.com to determine a user's Twitter ID, or use the following bookmarklet:

[expand=Bookmarklet to show ID]
[code]
javascript:(() => {prompt('Twitter ID', `https://twitter.com/intent/user?user_id=${JSON.parse(document.querySelector(%27script[data-testid=%22UserProfileSchema-test%22]%27)?.textContent)?.author?.identifier}`)})()
[/code]
[/expand]

See [[help:artists]] for more information about artist entries.

h4. See also

* [[bad twitter id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]
* [[twitter sample]]

title: help:translated_tags
body:
Names used for this tag on other sites such as Pixiv. Danbooru can compare the Other Name entries with the tags listed on the external site and list the corresponding Danbooru tags under a "translated" column in the Related Tags section when uploading.

h4. Setting up a tag

In order for the translated tags feature to work for a tag, the tag's wiki page must have the corresponding names from external sites set. To set these, find the tag's wiki page and go to edit it. If it doesn't have a wiki, create one. In the [b]Other names[/b] field, put the name(s) that other sites use for this tag, separated by spaces.

For example, the [[original]] wiki has オリジナル in its Other names, because オリジナル is the Japanese term for original works and is used on sites such as Pixiv.

h4. Using translated tags

In order to use translated tags when uploading, you should use the "official upload bookmarklet":/static/bookmarklet. If you do, the site will automatically fetch data from the source you're uploading from, and then provide a list of translated tags in the Related Tags section under "translated", which you can click to add each one.

If you're not using the bookmarklet to upload, you can instead manually click "Fetch source data" (you must first put the source URL in the Source field). You can use the same "Fetch source data" link to use translated tags on a post that has already been uploaded, in the Edit section. However, this method doesn't work with all sites that the bookmarklet does.

Currently, sites that work with translated tags are: Pixiv, Nico Seiga, and Nijie (bookmarklet only).

h4. What to put in the wiki Other names field

* Character and copyright names in other languages.
* General tags used on other sites only if they correspond exactly to a tag on Danbooru.

Be careful not to add names that sound similar, but in practice are used very differently on other sites.

h4. What Not to put in the wiki Other names field

* An artist's other names. These should go in the artist entry's other names field instead of the wiki's. There is also an artist finder which automatically suggests the correct artist for a post which works separately from translated tags. See [[help:artists]] for more details.

title: help:qualifiers
body:
Qualifiers are those things in parenthesis you see at the end of some tags. They serve to make the exact meaning of the tag clear so there is no confusion with other tags.

There are many types of qualifiers.

h4. Artist qualifiers

Many artists go by a short name that can be shared by other artists or characters. So Danbooru qualifies them with another text string that is related to that artist. It may be:

* the artist's website or blog name
* circle name
* The username (often different from their actual displayed name) that artist uses on a site like Pixiv, Twitter, DeviantART, Tinami, etc.
* Nickname

Examples: [[shimo_(depthbomb)]] / [[aile_(crossroads)]] / [[alphonse_(white_datura)]]

See [[help:artists]] for more info.

h4. Series Qualifiers

For names of characters that can be confused with characters from other series, or with artists. If the series name is long, an abbreviation may be used for the qualifier.

Examples: [[yamada_maya_(infinite_stratos)]] / [[knight_(ragnarok_online)]] / [[araya_(nakaimo)]] / [[angel_(evangelion)]]

h4. Cosplay Qualifier

[[hatsune_miku_(cosplay)]] automatically adds both [[hatsune_miku]] and [[cosplay]] to a post.

h4. Meme Qualifier

[[longcat_(meme)]] automatically adds [[meme]] to a post.

h4. Distinguishing copyrights from characters or objects

[[metroid]] = The game series
[[metroid_(creature)]] = The alien creatures from the series

[[claymore_(series)]] = The manga and anime series.
[[claymore_(sword)]] = A type of sword, which the manga was named after.

h4. Alternate forms of characters

Examples: [[hatsune_miku_(append)]] / [[saigyouji_yuyuko_(living)]]

title: howto:pawoo
body:
"Pawoo":https://pawoo.net/ is an instance of "Mastodon":https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon run by [[Pixiv]] Inc. It is best known as an alternative to [[Twitter]] for posting NSFW art, especially [[loli]], [[shota]], and [[toddlercon]].

On pawoo (and other instances of Mastodon), 'tweets' are referred to as 'toots', 'likes' are referred to as 'favorites' and 'retweets' are referred to as 'boosts'.

This page will describe how to sign up and upload from Pawoo, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Word of caution

Uploading from pawoo is unadvised for a few reasons:

* All jpg images are resampled (albeit at a lower rate than Twitter)
* All images are currently configured to be resized to a maximum of 1280x1280, much smaller than what Twitter allows.

You should always look for a better image source off another site such as pixiv or nicoseiga if it is available ([[help:image source]]).

h4. Signing up

Pawoo will not allow you to view links to the timeline if you do not have an account. That includes links like these:

* https://pawoo.net/web/accounts/8525
* https://pawoo.net/web/statuses/33721

The interface now has an English interface that also allows you to sign up with your pixiv account, so signing up should be fairly straightforward.

h4. Uploading

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the toot URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet. The link to a toot should look something like this:

* https://pawoo.net/@maaya/33721

It's important to note that the HTML URL to the toot is much more preferred than that of the direct image URL to the tweet for various reasons. Artist information and commentary, for example, are readily available to pull from the image source if the tweet has not been taken down yet.

The upload page will [b]NOT[/b] always correct your source to the HTML link for you. Remember to correct it yourself when it so happens.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them, or correct their artist entry if they have changed their twitter handle.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]]. If the source is not fixed after your upload has completed, you will have to fix it yourself.

h4. Artist entries

Most pawoo users will have a pixiv account, usually listed somewhere in their profile. If not that, they they may also have a twitter account to reference. In cases like these, see [[howto:pixiv]] or [[howto:twitter]]. Remember to add new Pawoo account URLs to their artist entries if they exist.

If none can be found, see [[help:artists]] for how to romanize their name and add a new artist entry for them.

h4. See also

* topic #13941
* [[help:pawoo api|Pawoo API]]
* {{source:https://pawoo.net/}}
* {{source:https://img.pawoo.net/}} -- this should have no matches.
* {{source:https://pawoo.net/media/}} -- neither should this.

h4. External links

* "pawoo.net Source Code":https://github.com/pixiv/mastodon

title: howto:nijie
body:
Nijie is a website where a number of Japanese artists upload their works. It has a primary focus on sexually suggestive and explicit works. In addition to [[pixiv]] and [[niconico|nicoseiga]], it is another major source of images on Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from nijie, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

Here's the ideal procedure when uploading from Nijie.

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. Luckily, Nijie does not actually have samples in case you decide not to go this route, but it is still highly recommended. The bookmarklet works from both [code]view.php[/code] and [code]view_popup.php[/code] pages. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]].

h4. Artist naming

Rule of thumb is: Make a [b]simple, readable, and memorizable[/b] tag.

The first choice is to use the artist's real name if you can find it on any websites or blogs listed on their nijie profile. See [[help:artists]] for advice on finding the artist's name on their website.

Many artists also have [[pixiv]] accounts in addition to their Nijie account. Refer to [[howto:pixiv]] for more information in the case you find one.

Once you have a name, [[howto:romanize|romanize it]]. Name kanji often have several different readings, so it's best to use any available indicators (such as their twitter handle) on how to read the name. If you don't know how to read this name or are unsure of the correct reading, post in topic #8199 to ask for help.

Note that Nijie nicknames are not necessarily unique. If it is too generic ("Ken", "Daisuke", "Youko", etc.), add a qualifier to make it unique. Good choices for qualifiers include:

* The artist's circle name
** e.g. [[gurande_(g-size)]]
* The artist's twitter handle
** e.g. [[oyamada_(pi0v0jg)]]
* If nothing else exists, their nijie ID
** This is a very rare case, and should be avoided.

h5. Things to note

* [b]Do not[/b] use non-ASCII characters for the artist's name, even if they look like ASCII letters--Ｒｙｕ is not the same as Ryu. Save that for the "Other names" field.
* [b]Do not[/b] use "_(nijie)" or "_(artist)" as the qualifier. There are probably a dozen Nijie artists named Sakura or Miki, so those qualifiers are simply not effective.
* [b]Try not to[/b] make a hard to read name like [[ken_(oooxvbgj)]].

h4. Artist entries

To create or edit an artist entry, click the '?' next to the artist tag in the tag list. In the artist entry, add:

h6. Other Names
* The artist's Nijie nickname (found under their profile picture).
* Any other account names, Twitter handles, or nicknames on other sites the artist lists in their profile.

h6. URLs
* The Nijie profile URL: http://nijie.info/members.php?id=10543
* URLs of any other websites the artist lists in their Nijie profile.

h4. See also

* [[bad nijie id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:tumblr
body:
[[Tumblr]] is a social networking website that allows users to post multimedia and other content to a short blog. It is a popular source of images for Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from Tumblr, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

Uploading using either the bookmarklet or upload page will automatically retrieve the best image available. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer and risk it being an [[image sample]]. For more technical details, you may expand the following:

[expand]
Tumblr has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[tumblr sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here. These samples may carry one of multiple available file name suffixes: 

* [code]_75sq[/code] (sample; thumbnail)
* [code]_100[/code] (sample; thumbnail)
* [code]_250[/code] (sample)
* [code]_400[/code] (sample)
* [code]_500[/code] (sample; sometimes original, see forum #132817)
* [code]_500h[/code] (sample; height-bounded)
* [code]_540[/code] (sample)
* [code]_640[/code] (sample)
* [code]_1280[/code] (sample; sometimes original)

Where the original usually ends with:

* [code]_raw[/code]

In addition to these, any image that matches the following query is also a sample [i]unless[/i] it has a [b]r*[/b] (r1, r2, etc.) in the filename:

* {{source:*tumblr.com/ md5_mismatch downscaled status:active}}

post #2568503 is not a sample, for example (note the [b]r2[/b]).
[/expand]

h5. Using the bookmarklet

[b]This method is highly recommended![/b]

[b]1.[/b] Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. If you wish to upload multiple images, use the batch bookmarklet.

[b]2.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

[b]3.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]]. If your source link isn't fixed, you should remember to fix that also.

h5. Using the "uploads":/uploads/new page

[b]1.[/b] Copy the image URL into the [b]Source[/b] box. The upload page will automatically retrieve the largest size available (typically [code]_raw[/code]), so you won't need to change it unless you wish to be extra careful. Just like above, the image URL for "this post":[http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/post/154203047608] is "this":[https://68.media.tumblr.com/8818848735da2f77be8669c45e8d3bae/tumblr_ohva67iieD1tq4vrto2_r2_1280.jpg].

[b]2.[/b] Tag your post and upload it.

[b]3.[/b] Since the upload page will not correct the source for you as there is no referrer, you must remember to correct it yourself. Just like above, the source should point to the tumblr post and look something like "this":[http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/post/154203047608].

h4. Artist naming

Before creating a new artist, search for an existing artist entry using the following steps:

[b]1.[/b]. Search for the artist Tumblr homepage URL using the "Danbooru Artists page":[/artists]. It should look something like this:

* http://r-ringo00001.tumblr.com/

[b]2.[/b] Using the same method, search for any other URL from the artist's Tumblr profile if available, or use "SauceNAO":[http://saucenao.com/] or "IQDB":[http://danbooru.iqdb.org/] to see if any of artist's images turn up any hits for Danbooru. You may find there already exists an entry for the artist. If so, then add the artist's Tumblr URL to their artist entry and stop here. If not, follow the next step.

[b]3.[/b] Create a "new artist entry":[/artists/new].

* See [[Help:Artists]] for more information.
* Ask for help in topic #8199 if you are unsure.

h4. See also

* [[tumblr sample]]
* [[bad tumblr id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:tinami
body:
[[Tinami]] is a Japanese online community for artists. It is a minor source of images for Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from tinami, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

[b]Uploading using the "danbooru bookmarklet":/static/bookmarklet is [u]currently unavailable[/u] for Tinami.[/b]

Additionally, [b]uploading using the image URL on the "uploads page":[/uploads/new] [u]will not work either[/u].[/b] This is due to an issue with Tinami that requires the HTTP Referer header to be from the Tinami domain. (See Issue #2818)

Therefore, uploading from Tinami requires downloading the image to your local machine, then uploading it using the file function from the [b]uploads page[/b].

After uploading the image, edit the source so that it points to the original post page and not the image link (ex: [b][nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/view/1234[/nodtext][/b]).  This will make it easier to find the artist and the original post that picture came from.

h4. Artist naming

Before creating a new artist, search for an existing artist entry using the following steps:

1. Search for the artist Tinami profile URL (ex: [b][nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/creator/profile/1234[/nodtext][/b]) from the "Danbooru Artists page":[/artists].

2. Search for any other URL from the artist's Tinami profile using the method in [b]#1[/b] above.

3. Use "SauceNAO":[http://saucenao.com/] or "IQDB":[http://danbooru.iqdb.org/] to see if any of artist's thumbnail images turn up any hits for Danbooru. [tn][b]Note: [/b]Thumnail images do not have the same restrictions as regular image links, which is why this works[/tn]
* See [[Help:Image Source]] for more help on reverse-image search engines.
* Use thumbnail images from the artists gallery and not their profile, as the profile thumbnails get cropped.
** [b]This:[/b] [nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/search/list?prof_id=1234[/nodtext]
** [b]Not this:[/b] [nodtext]http://www.tinami.com/creator/profile/1234[/nodtext]

4. Create a "new artist entry":[/artists/new].

* See [[Help:Artists]] for more information.
* Ask for help in topic #8199 if you are unsure.

h4. See also

* [[tinami sample]]
* [[bad tinami id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: danboorubot
body:
This is a template entry for [[help:artists]]. The wiki for an artist is not intended to supply URLs for the artist, but special exceptions exist for special cases.

DanbooruBot is not a real person, and thus can't be tagged on any posts in sincerity.

title: shizuku_no_oto
body:
[b]Shizuku no Oto[/b] (also known as [b]Sound of Drop -fall into poison-[/b]) is a game by LYCORIS.

In Tokyo's Manten Aquarium, a place shrouded in urban legends like blood-red waters on full moon nights and man-faced fish, junior high students Mayu and Himeno visit to investigate. Their fun investigation takes a dark turn when they spot a glimpse of Mayu's missing younger sister, Mari. As they pursue Mari's shadow, fate intervenes, leaving Mayu alone and lost within the eerie, crimson-tinted aquarium.

h4. External links

* "vndb: Shizuku no Oto":[https://vndb.org/v15940]
* "Steam":[https://store.steampowered.com/app/383460/Sound_of_Drop__fall_into_poison/]

title: inugami_korone_(street)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]].

Her second costume consists of a [[red headwear|red]] [[beret]], a [[brown capelet]] with a detachable [[brown cape|cape]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[frilled shirt|shirt]] with [[center frills]] and a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled collar]], a [[plaid bowtie|plaid]] [[yellow bowtie]] with a [[paw hair ornament|paw ornament]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] or [[brown socks|brown]] [[kneehighs]] and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[mary janes]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Long hair]] tied into [[twin braids|twin]] [[side braids]] or [[sidelocks]]
* [[Medium hair|Medium-length hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15445491: Profile
* !post #3644438: Merchandise (Halloween variant)
other_names: 戌神ころね(おでかけ衣装)

title: maya_(mon-musu_quest!)
body:
Maya, also known as Miko Arachne (巫女アラクネ) is a monster and possible companion in [[mon-musu_quest:_paradox|Monster Girl Quest: Paradox]].
She's a [[miko|Shrine Maiden]] despite being a monster girl.

title: untied_panties
body:
Panties that are [[untied]] on one or both sides. 

Tag [[untying]] and maybe [[strap pull]] if the character is in the middle of untying her panties. Do not confuse with [[holding panties]] which is for when the panties are completely [[unworn panties|removed]].



h4. See also

* [[Untying]] (for the active act of untying)
* [[Wardrobe malfunction]] (if the cause is accidental or otherwise unlooked-for)
* [[Assisted exposure]] (if the cause is through deliberate action)

title: holding_panties
body:
Holding a pair of [[unworn panties|removed panties]].

Do not confuse with [[adjusting panties]] and [[untying]] [[untied panties]] as in both cases, the panties are still on the body.

h4. See also

* [[holding bra]]
* [[presenting removed panties]]

title: artifact_(genshin_impact)
body: Items from [[Genshin Impact]] that aside from weapons, serve as a main form of increasing a character's stats. There are five main categories which generally, but not always, have the appearance of the object implied by their title: * Flower of Life (a.k.a. "the flower") * Plume of Death (a.k.a. "the feather") * Sands of Eon (a.k.a. "the clock", "the hourglass" or "the timepiece") * Goblet of Eonothem (a.k.a. "the cup") * Circlet of Logos (a.k.a. "the crown", "the hat" or "the headpiece") There are also a multitude of themed sets which grant bonuses when equipped in matching combinations. h4. See also * [[List of Genshin Impact tags]] h4. External links * "Genshin Impact Wiki: Artifact":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Artifact]

title: eotech_g33
body:
A magnifying device designed to be used in conjunction with the [[EOTech]] series of holographic sights. 
Comes with either 2X or 3X magnification.

title: eotech_exps3
body:
A compact variant of the [[EOTech]] holographic sight that is powered by CR123 rather than common AA batteries.

Distinguishable by its side-mounted controls for compatibility with magnifiers, quick-detach lever on the left side of the sight, and a button to enable or disable night-vision mode.

title: oculus_(genshin_impact)
body:
An object from [[Genshin Impact]]. Oculi are [[orb]]s containing immense elemental energy that can be collected and offered to corresponding [[Statue of the Seven|Statues of the Seven]], restoring them for rewards.

The general design has a center core with an elemental symbol orbited by two exterior decorations. The specific colors and design of the oculus varies by its element and region.

h4. Types

* !post #5360540: Anemoculus
* !asset #25680289: Dendroculus
* !post #5360549: Electroculus
* !post #5360562: Geoculus
* !asset #25680303: Hydroculus
* !asset #25680305: Pyroculus

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact tags]]

title: tubalcain_alhambra
body:
First Lieutenant Tubalcain Alhambra 《トバルカイン・アルハンブラ中尉, Tobarukain Aruhanbura Chūi》 is a major antagonist in the [[Hellsing]] series created by Kohta Hirano. He is voiced by Houchu Otsuka in the Japanese sub and Steve Wilcox in the English dub.

Otherwise known simply as "The Dandy 《伊達だて男, Dateotoko, OVA: Dandy Man》," Tubalcain is an agent of the Millennium Project who appears calculating and powerful as he issues a challenge to Alucard in [[Rio De Janeiro]]. Well dressed and well mannered, his peculiar and unique skill is that of being able to attack with a deck of [[Playing Card|Playing Cards]] whose deadly properties included such a keen sharpness they are able to slice cleanly through whatever stands in their way.

https://hellsing.fandom.com/wiki/Tubalcain_Alhambra

* !post #7838200
other_names: トバルカイン・アルハンブラ

title: fn_scar_17
body:
The [b][[battle rifle]][/b] variant of the [[FN SCAR]], chambered 7.62×51mm NATO. Also known as the SCAR-H or Mk17 in the [[united states|US]] "SOCOM":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Special_Operations_Command. Distinguishable by its straight 20-round [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] and longer barrel. The semi-auto civilian variant is dubbed "SCAR 17S".

h4. See also

* [[FN Mk 20 SSR]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: fn_mk_20_ssr
body:
The FN Mk 20 SSR (Sniper Support [[Rifle]]) is a 7.62×51mm NATO [b][[designated marksman rifle]][/b] manufactured by [[FN Herstal]], based on the [[FN SCAR 17]]. It features a non-folding adjustable buttstock with a cheek rest and an extended receiver. 

h4. See also

* [[FN SCAR]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[SCAR-H (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "FN America website":https://fnamerica.com/products/rifles/fn-mk20-ssr/
* "Wikipedia: FN SCAR#Military variants":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FN_SCAR#Military_variants

title: obr_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Larue Tactical OBR]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. Would receive a [[OBR (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

The caliber of her OBR varies from design to design. By default and while wearing [[OBR (envoy of spring) (girls' frontline)|Envoy of Spring]], it's a [[AR-10|Larue Tactical OBR 7.62]], while in [[OBR (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|MOD3]] and wearing [[OBR (Queen of Castile) (girls' frontline)|Queen of Castile]], it's a [[AR-15|Larue Tactical OBR 5.56]].

title: dagobah
body: Dagobah is a fictional planet and eponymous star system appearing in the [[Star Wars]] films The Empire Strikes Back, Return of the Jedi, and Revenge of the Sith, and other media. It is depicted as a world of murky swamps, steaming bayous, and jungles, resembling Earth during the Carboniferous period. Dagobah is 14,410 kilometers in diameter with an orbital period of 341 days. Dagobah's climate and atmosphere consists of two seasons: a dry season, where the uplands become too hot for most life forms to survive; and a wet season, consisting of violent lightning storms, dense fog, and long periods of torrential rainfall. The Tash were a sentient species native to Dagobah.

title: adeptus_astartes
body:
The [b]Adeptus Astartes[/b] (Space Marines) are a tabletop army in [[Warhammer 40K]]. They are a faction within the Imperium of Man, and consist of genetically modified warrior monks. The Adeptus Astartes is split into many chapters of a thousand marines. Each chapter has their own distinct appearance, and some differ quite a bit in terms of traits and tactics. Space Marines are known for wearing massive [[power armor]], painted in their chapter's colors, and wielding [[bolter]]s.

h4. Founding Chapters
* [[Dark Angels]] - I - led by [[Lion El'Jonson]] - Loyalist
* [I]DELETED[/I] - II - led by [b][REDACTED][/B] - ???
* [[Emperor's Children]] - III - led by [[Fulgrim]] - Traitor
* [[Iron Warriors]] - IV - led by [[Perturabo]] - Traitor
* [[White Scars]] - V - led by [[Jaghatai Khan]] - Loyalist 
* [[Space Wolves]] - VI - led by [[Leman Russ]] - Loyalist
* [[Imperial Fists]] - VII - led by [[Rogal Dorn]] - Loyalist
* [[Night Lords]] - VIII - led by [[Konrad Curze]] - Traitor
* [[Blood Angels]] - IX  - led by [[Sanguinius]] - Loyalist
* [[Iron Hands (Warhammer)|]] - X - led by [[Ferrus Manus]] - Loyalist
* [I]DELETED[/I] - XI - led by [b][REDACTED][/B] - ???
* [[World Eaters]] - XII - led by [[Angron]] - Traitor
* [[Ultramarines]] - XIII - led by [[Roboute Guilliman]] - Loyalist
* [[Death Guard]] - XIV- led by [[Mortarion]] - Traitor
* [[Thousand Sons]] - XV - led by [[Magnus the Red]] - Traitor
* [[Black Legion|Luna Wolves/Sons of Horus/Black Legion]] - XVI - led by [[Horus Lupercal]] - Traitor
* [[Word Bearers]] - XVII - led by [[Lorgar Aurelian]] - Traitor 
* [[Salamanders (Warhammer)|]] - XVIII - led by [[Vulkan]] - Loyalist
* [[Raven Guard]] - XIX - led by [[Corvus Corax (warhammer)|]] - Loyalist
* [[Alpha Legion]] - XX - led by [[Alpharius Omegon]] - Traitor

h6. Other Notable Chapters
* [[Black Templars]] - Successor chapter of [[Imperial Fists]]
* [[Blood Ravens]] - Chapter featured in [[Dawn of War]]
* [[Marines Malevolent]]
* [[Red Scorpions]]
* [[Carcharodons]]

h4. See also

title: hayabusa_(spacecraft)
body:
はやぶさ (hayabusa), also known as MUSES-C, is a space probe that the "JAXA":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Aerospace_Exploration_Agency developed and it's main purpose was to perform various technological experiments through a mission involving the returning of a sample from "an asteroid":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/25143_Itokawa]. 

This [[spacecraft]], while being hit with fatal complications many times over, returned to Earth. This great undertaking gathered social interest, and a "Hayabusa boom", big enough to make three movies, occurred. However, there are many space development fans who fear that this story may impede the improvement of the underlying causes like budgetary deficits. 

The solar paddles arranged in a H-shape, the four ion thrusters, a parabolic high-gain [[radio antenna]] and the re-entry capsule half embedded in the body are this probe's external characteristics. In Hayabusa's fan's artwork, almost always this "wok with a lid"-like shape a capsule is drawn. 

h4.See also 

* [[minerva_(spacecraft)]] / (asteroid rover) 
* [[spacecraft]] 
* [[atmospheric reentry]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayabusa]

title: houjou_satoko
body:
A character from [[Higurashi no Naku Koro Ni]]. Voiced by [[Kanai Mika]].

She tends to end most of her sentences with 'wa' and is quite clever with setting up traps. She also cannot tell the difference between cauliflower and broccoli.

She has [[purple eyes]] (sometimes drawn as [[red eyes|red]] or [[pink eyes|pink]]) and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]].

Her school attire consists of a [[black hairband]], [[green dress|green]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], and [[black pantyhose]].

Her casual attire consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[pink shirt]] [[shirt tucked in|tucked in]] [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts]].

Her best friend is [[Furude Rika]], her older brother is [[Houjou Satoshi]], and her uncle is [[Houjou Teppei]].

title: rags
body:
An old or tattered piece of clothing, usually seen worn on humanoid [[monster]]s or [[slave]]s.

In terms of appearance, they are usually very simple in design with almost no decoration/patterns and some sort of dull brown/grey color.

Not to be confused with [[cleaning rag]], which is used to wipe/clean things.

title: fn_scar_16
body:
The [b][[assault rifle]][/b] variant of the [[FN SCAR]], chambered for 5.56×45mm NATO [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]]. Also known as the SCAR-L or Mk16. Distinguishable by its curved 30-round STANAG [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. The tag can also be applied to the more compact SCAR-SC.
Its semi-auto civilian variant is referred to as the SCAR 16S.

title: suzuki_ichirou
body:
(鈴木 一朗 [i]Suzuki Ichirō[/i], born October 22, 1973)

Sometimes simply known as Ichiro (イチロー).

A Japanese former professional baseball outfielder. He began his career in 1992 playing for the [[Orix Buffaloes]] (then the Orix BlueWave) of Nippon Professional Baseball before joining Major League Baseball in 2000, starting with the [[Seattle Mariners]] and staying with them until 2012. Suzuki spent two seasons each with the [[New York Yankees]] and the [[Miami Marlins]] before finishing out his career as a Mariner in 2018. He officially retired on March 21, 2019.

He had a unique ritual of holding his bat upright at arm's length, and tugging at his sleeve before getting set for each pitch.

Because of his achievements both in Japan and the United States, he was elected in both Japanese and American Baseball Halls of Fame; his induction into the US Hall of Fame was the first for a Japanese player.

title: ainz_ooal_gown
body:
The Antho-protagonist from the series [[overlord_(maruyama)|Overlord by Maruyama]].

He is the Evil Overlord ruling the Great Tomb of Nazarick. Ainz, originally called Momonga, is a [[skeleton]] mage called a "[[Lich]]" and one of the most powerful people in the world who, while good with tactics and quick thinking, lacks foresight and often underestimates the behavior of his underlings. This has set the plot in motion that everyone wants to conquer the world for him, something he often worries about. Nicknamed "The Strongest Spellcaster, with the Appearance of a Skeleton" due to the aforementioned reasons.

Ainz also sometimes plays the role of "[[Momon (overlord)|]]", a black knight who fights with two huge swords, often with the purpose of collecting new information by doing undercover missions. Helping him in this endeavor is [[Narberal Gamma]], assuming the name "[[Nabe_(Overlord)|]]" and pretending to be his colleague, rather than servant.
other_names: アインズ・ウール・ゴウン
モモンガ(オーバーロード)

title: rydia_(ff4)
body:
A playable summoner in [i][[Final Fantasy IV]][/i]. Found by [[Cecil Harvey]] in the ruins of her hometown, the hero takes it upon himself to take her to the nearest inn. Rydia is initally distrusting of Cecil, but eventually warms up to him as he goes on a quest to cure his beloved [[Rosa Farrell|Rosa]] of a fatal fever.

[spoiler]After being knocked off a ship by Leviathan, Rydia is taken to the Feymarch, the Land of Summons, and discovers her full potential as a summoner. The warped time flow of the Feymarch causes Rydia to reach adulthood by the time she reunites with Cecil.[/spoiler]

h4.See also

* [[Rydia (Adult) (ff4)|]]
* [[Rydia (Young) (ff4)|]]

title: st_ar-15_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Colt [[AR-15]] in [[Girls' Frontline]], specifically one by Spikes Tactical.

She has a long [[pink hair]] with [[streaked hair|a blue streak]], a [[one side up|part of her hair tied to the side]] with a [[hair ornament|hairpin that is shaped like a cross-section of an AR-15 quad rail]], and [[blue eyes]]. In her default images she wears a white [[dress]], [[fingerless gloves]] and a [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg. In her 'Literary Girl' skin she wears white [[thighhighs]] and a [[school uniform]]. her rifle's [[magpul]] stock is replaced with a PDW-style stock.

A member of the [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]]-led [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]], AR-15 is very insecure about being the only civilian model weapon in her team. This goes so far as to her becoming self-conscious when the Commander looks at her trademark. 

Would receive a [[ST AR-15 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

Her illustrator [[LIN+]] adapted her design from his Pixiv Fantasia character, known under many names, who in their last incarnation was known as [[Berlinetta (pixiv fantasia)|]]. She is voiced by [[Katou Emiri]].

h4. Appearance

title: final_gear
body:
A mecha-themed, all-female shooting game by Chinese studio Flashwing. An evolution of the original [[Artery Gear]], the game came into being as its own IP after a set of nasty lawsuits ended up splitting Flashwing in half. It is a more direct evolution of the shooter gameplay of the original Armor Girls, while [[Artery Gear: Fusion]] went in a different direction. Final Gear is, as noted, a separate IP from Artery Gear, and does not feature the same characters.

The game shut down on March 5, 2024.

title: takarazuka_revue
body:
A Japanese all-female musical theater troupe, founded in 1913 and based in Takarazuka, Hyougo Prefecture, Japan. Women play all roles in lavish, Broadway-style productions of Western-style musicals, and sometimes stories adapted from shoujo manga and Japanese folktales.

The Revue has had a marked influence on anime and manga, including the growth of the shoujo and [[yuri]] genres, as well as the [[bishounen]] trope.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Takarazuka Revue":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takarazuka_Revue

title: nahel_argama
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise.

[b]SCVA-76 Nahel Argama[/b]

A one-off assault cruiser built by [[Anaheim Electronics]], meant to supplant the badly damaged [[AEUG]] [[Argama]]. Sporting 5 hangars, 5 catapults, and a multitude of weapons, the Nahel Argama was a mighty battleship in its own right, but perhaps its greatest asset was the immensely powerful High Mega Particle Cannon that could vaporize a colony in a single shot. 

It was operated by [[Bright Noa]] until he left command of the ship to the [i][[Gundam Team]][/i], and after that it was turned to the Federation, where it served in the prestigious [[char's_counterattack|Londo Bell unit]].

title: venom_sword
body: The [[Vessel of Sin|Vessel of Lust]], inhabited by the demon [spoilers][[Gilles Derais (evillious nendaiki)|]][/spoilers]. A magical tool created by the [[Seth Twiright]] inspired by the [[katana|swords]] from the eastern kingdom of Jakoku. After Leviantha's Cathastrophe, it was recollected by [[Irina Clockworker]] who hand it to the eldest son of the Venomania family, who used it to fullfill his wish leading to the infamous Venomania Incident and the disappearance of countless women across Asmodean.

title: gensokyo's_first_hakurei_miko
body:
The Miko of the Hakurei Shrine from the time when Gensokyo was first formed. [spoilers]Revealed in the end of [[Foul Detective Satori]] to be the one who sealed [[Miyadeguchi Mizuchi]] away.[/spoilers]

Note that she is not the direct canon equivalent of [[Sendai Hakurei no Miko]], a character from [[M.U.G.E.N]] depicted as Reimu's immediate predecessor. This Hakurei comes from long before that time.

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_(summer)
body:
An official alternate costume for [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] in [i][[Sonic Speed Simulator]][/i].

It features:
* A vibrant yellow Hawaiian shirt.
* A blue luau necklace.
* Stylish sunglasses perched on his head.
* The Light Speed Shoes, modeled after their appearance in [i][[Sonic Adventure]][/i], complete with yellow glowing heels. The soles of these shoes also feature the text "Sonic Adventure".

The design of the costume draws inspiration from multiple sources:
* Overall Concept: Based on the [[Joypolis]] Watermelon Sonic Plushie.
* Sunglasses: Identical to the sunglasses Sonic wears during his story's ending screen in [i]Sonic Adventure[/i].
* Shell Bracelet: First seen in [i][[Sonic X]][/i], Episode 9: "The Last Resort".
* Shoes: Directly replicates the Light Speed Shoes from [i]Sonic Adventure[/i].

body:

title: code:_ultimate_(elsword)
body:
[[eve (elsword)|Eve]]'s third character class following [[code: nemesis (elsword)|Code: Nemesis]], also being the final class of this path.

[b]Appearance[/b]
Building up on the [[Code: Nemesis (elsword)|]] design, [[Eve (elsword)|]] keeps her hair down while wearing a [[mecha musume]]-like outfit with [[thigh boots|thighhigh]] [[armored boots]] and [[black gloves]].
Notable changes are the new existence of an mechanical [[crown]] which covers her emotion core which is visible in her [[code: exotic (elsword)|first]] and [[code: nemesis (elsword)|second]] class of this path. Followed by the expansion of her [[mechanical wings]] to an extensive size. Her [[armored skirt|]] also becomes more pronounced and longer, becoming more of an [[armored dress]] at this point. Lastly, her [[mechanical ears]] also change to become more [[spikes|spike]] shaped. 
Lastly, her companions of [[Moby (elsword)|]] and [[Remy (elsword)|]] further evolve as well.

Post #2945607 - Offical game art.

title: zinger_(donkey_kong)
body:
Common enemy [[wasp]]s from the [[Donkey Kong_(series)|]] series, debuting in the original [[Donkey Kong Country]]. 

They act as obstacles to be avoided, due to their abdomen being covered in [[spikes]]. Usually the Kongs alone can't defeat them with a simple jump, and need either a thrown projectile or an Animal Friend.

They come in a multitude of colors, with yellow being the default.

h4. See Also
* [[Buzz (donkey kong)|]]

title: who's_that_pokemon_(meme)
body:
A parody of the eyecatch screens used in the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]] before and after the commercial breaks. The first half of the episode cut to commercial with a [[silhouette]] view of a [[Pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] and asked, "Who's that Pokémon?" and returned from the commercial by colorizing the silhouette to reveal the Pokémon with a cry of "It's (species name)! (Pokemon says its name)."

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia: Who's That Pokémon?":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Who's_That_Pok%C3%A9mon%3F]

title: split_screen
body:
When the image is split into two halves with a line. Several uses for this include comparing a character's different forms; placing two characters side by side in two columns (for more columns, see [[column lineup]]); or a technique used to convey [[split theme|two clashing characters]].

h4. See also

* [[Column lineup]] - character lineup split into different columns or rows
* [[Split crop]] - only one side of the character is shown 
* [[Split theme]] - for images composed as one character but with two different halves

body:
A person who temporarily looks after [[child]]ren while their parents are busy. Often played for laughs with an [[exhausted]] or [[annoyed]] babysitter looking after rambunctious [[aged down]] versions of other characters.

Unlike a [[teacher]], this is not necessarily a formal position - older [[siblings]] are often assigned a babysitter role, for example.

title: ump40_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP40]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Curiously, one of the few select instances of dolls that can be obtained in-game that are unambiguously considered non-canon, even more so than other cases. [spoiler]She ends up representing three characters in-game as a result: the non-canon acquireable UMP40, who hangs out with [[MP5 (girls' frontline)|]], the canon UMP40 who was [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]]'s sister and died during the Butterfly Incident, and the UMP40 OGAS that developed in UMP45's Neural Cloud on the basis of her memories of UMP40.[/spoiler] In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], UMP40 appears as [[Lainie (girls' frontline 2)|]][spoiler], the OGAS receiving her own body[/spoiler].

Her original illustrator [[Renatus.Z]] adapted her design from one of his Pixiv Fantasia characters, [[Natius (pixiv fantasia)|]]. Following Renatus' departure, other illustrators have picked her up to do her skins. She is voiced by Uema Umi.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2802576: Playable default
* !post #3404470: Story default
* !post #3291892: Orchestra

h4. Skins

* !post #6160698: [[ump40 (the wish-preserving witch of shadows) (girls' frontline)|The Wish-Preserving Witch of Shadows]]
* !post #4706601: [[UMP40 (Kleines Ritornello) (girls' frontline)|Kleines Ritornello]]
* !post #5703596: [[UMP40 (Moon River) (girls' frontline)|Moon River]]

h4. See also

title: list_of_dungeon_and_fighter_characters
body:
A list of [[Dungeon and Fighter]] characters. Classes are listed by their subclass name, followed by their 1st and 2nd Awakening names in parentheses.

h4. Playable character classes

h6. [[male slayer (dungeon and fighter)|Slayer (male)]]

* [[weapon_master_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Weapon Master]] (Grand Master, Omniblade)
* [[soul_bender_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Soul Bender]] (Soul Reaper, Dark Lord)
* [[berserker_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Berserker]] (Hell Bringer, Blood Evil)
* [[asura_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Asura]] (Silent Eye, Indra)
* [[ghostblade_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Ghostblade]] (Yaksha, Rakshasa)

h6. [[female_slayer_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Slayer (female)]]

* [[sword_master_(dungeon_and_fighter)|Sword Master]] (Noblesse, Majesty)

title: reversible_couple
body:
A [[couple]] that switches between dominant and submissive roles, sexual or not. 
This can involve any sexual act and does not require [[anal]] or vaginal [[sex]], but it is the most common depiction.

Especially in [[yaoi]], a reversible couple will top and bottom for one another. [[Hetero]] and [[yuri]] couples may make use of a [[strap-on]] to achieve penetration. 

Different roles for each character can appear in:- 

* Single image: post #6739606, post #6138695
* In a related image: post #6755546 with post #6755554
* Non-sexual depiction: post #6657405, post #6534375 with post #6537710, post #6947169 with post #6947170
* Implied [[reversible couple]]: post #6573362, post #6921017

This tag does not apply to images where a character tops and bottoms with different individuals.

h4. See also 

* [[assertive female]]
* [[muscular uke]]
* [[top/bottom dynamic annotated]]
* [[role reversal]]

title: top/bottom_dynamic_annotated
body:
When an illustration indicates who tops, and who bottoms in a relationship. Alternately, the illustration may contain [[multiple views]] of the same character annotated as being "top" and "bottom" versions of them.

Depending on context, that means either who's the one penetrating and penetrated, the one who dominates and the one who submits, the one who is active and who is passive, and so on. This also applies to other related terms, such as seme (攻め) and uke (受け), tachi (タチ) and neko (ネコ), or 凸 and 凹.

This practice is especially common in [[yaoi]] works that do not depict penetrative sex directly, as top/bottom preference in a character is often associated with specific personality traits, though it may also be seen in non-yaoi works.

h4. Examples

* !post #8897706
* !post #6492944
* !post #8862207
* !post #5199633
* !post #1334794

h4. See also

* [[pov crotch]]

* [[power bottom]]
* [[muscular uke]]

title: sendai_hakurei_no_miko_(osana_reimu)
body:
The [[Sendai Hakurei No Miko]] from the very popular fanwork [[Osana Reimu]] and its sequel [[Reireimu]], a story about Sendai Miko, a young Reimu, and an [[EX-Rumia|adult]] [[Rumia]]. This brown-haired version looks almost identical to Reimu herself, only taller and more endowed - and usually wearing some sort of [[mask]].

Other variations exist which show her taking more from the [[sendai hakurei no miko (m.u.g.e.n)|M.U.G.E.N]] version of the character, such as her outfit and pitch-black hair. Again, a mask is often used to distinguish her as the Osana Reimu Sendai.

title: sendai_hakurei_no_miko_(m.u.g.e.n)
body:
先代博麗の巫女 ([i]Sendai Hakurei no Miko[/i], "The previous generation's Hakurei shrine maiden")

A fanmade [[M.U.G.E.N]] character by MUGEN author Pre-to and [[Touhou]] [[Original]] Character.

Depicted as [[hakurei_reimu|Reimu]]'s predecessor. She was apparently not created with a proper given(first) name, so her name may vary. Usually portrayed as a powerful physical fighter.

She wears a [[nontraditional miko|customized]] miko uniform consisting of a one-piece skintight [[leotard]] rather than a sarashi (frequently resulting in [[sideboob]]), sturdy [[combat boots]], and sometimes [[hakama pants]] rather than a skirt.

Also, unlike Reimu, she does not wear a ribbon on the back of her head, although in some depictions, she wears one to tie her long hair together near the end. Some artists depict her as muscular and/or covered in scars.

She is usually depicted as Reimu's mother, though as a fan character her relation to Reimu on the Hakurei family tree can change with each depiction.

title: gunko
body:
Gunko is a character from [[One Piece]]. She was first introduced during the Elbaph Arc, along with [spoilers]other [b]God's Knights[/b] like [[Figarland Shamrock]], [[Shepherd Sommers]] and [[Rimoshifu Killingham]][/spoilers].

She wears a [[double-breasted]] [[black jacket]] that has [[sleeves past fingers]] and a [[black hat|black]] [[peaked cap]], most likely a [[rogatywka]]. She's dressed in [[black panties]] and [[black boots]]. Depending on the height of her [[bandaged leg|bandaged legs]], she may have [[bare legs]].

Gunko has [[heterochromia]] in the form of both [[mismatched pupils]] and [[mismatched irises]]. A [[mouth mask]] adorns her face. She has [[short hair]] and there are [[goggles on headwear|goggles on her hat]].

As for Gunko's [[devil fruit power|powers]], [spoilers]she ate the Aro Aro no Mi, a [[devil fruit]] that grants her the power to cast and use [[arrow (symbol)|arrow symbols]] in various ways[/spoilers].
