title: pottery
body:
[b]pottery[/b] are any objects that made from fired [[clay]] or other moldable materials, and hold both liquids and solids inside of them, this especially included any vessels and trays that hold [[food]]s and [[drink]]s like [[bottle]]s, [[jar]]s, [[pot]]s, [[dishes]], and [[bowl]]s. Any general clay objects can be categorized as pottery, but more specific ceramic materials like earthenware, porcelain, and stoneware can also be broadly covered by this tag.

h4. Related tags

* [[potters wheel]]
* [[cinder block]]
* [[brick]]
* [[concrete]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pottery":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pottery]

title: potters_wheel
body:
A [[machine]] used for spinning [[clay]] or another moldable material to make symmetrically even pattern on the workpiece to create the perfect shape of the [[pottery]] by trimming excess clay off it, with user's bare hand or some hand [[tools]], before it can fired. It can be electrical or foot-powered.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Potter's wheel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potter%27s_wheel]

title: blunderbuss
body:
A [b]blunderbuss[/b] is a [[firelock]] muzzle-loading [[gun|firearm]] with a short, large caliber barrel, which is flared at the muzzle and frequently throughout the entire bore.  this allows the weapon spread all the projectiles to any directions, from its flared muzzle, A blunderbuss can fire round lead pellets and any smaller projectiles of relevant quantity and/or caliber. It's essentially a one-shot muzzle-loaded [[shotgun]], during the 17th century to the 18th century.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Flintlock]]
* [[Musket]]

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: Blunderbuss":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blunderbuss

title: dreyse_needle_gun
body:
The [b]Dreyse needle gun[/b] is an single-shot [[bolt action]], breech-loading [[rifle]] that was invented by Johann Nikolaus von Dreyse. It is famous for being the first bolt-action rifle that has been fielded by an national military, and serve as the design basis of all future bolt-action rifles that surpassed it. It entered in service as the main infantry weapons of the [[Prussia]]n Army in 1841, toward the unification of the [[German Empire]] in 1871. After the unification, it was replaced by an improved version of it as the [b]Mauser Model 1871[/b], which further improvement of the design has led to the rise of the the Mauser [[gun|rifle]] family, which its latest version is the [[Mauser 98]].

Its military designation as the "ignition needle rifle" (German: Zündnadelgewehr) was based on its firing pin, since it passed like a needle through the paper  [[cartridge]] to strike a percussion cap at the base of the bullet.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dreyse needle gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dreyse_needle_gun
* "Wikipedia: needle gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/needle_gun

title: fusil_mle._1866
body:
The [b]Fusil modèle 1866[/b] (Also known as the [b]Chassepot[/b]) is a single-shot breech-loaded [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] that was invented in 1866 by Antoine Alphonse [b]Chassepot[/b] and used a needle ignition mechanism to fire a wax paper cartridge, like [[dreyse needle gun]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chassepot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chassepot

title: madsen_machine_gun
body:
The [b]Madsen[/b] [[machine gun]] is a Danish magazine-fed, recoil-operated [[light machine gun]]. It can recognized by its curved [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] that feeds from the top, the [[bipod]] on its [[barrel shroud]] and its carry handle, like the [[bren lmg|Bren]], but unlike it, the Madsen is more shorter than the Bren and lacks a pistol grip.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia entry: "Madsen machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madsen_machine_gun

title: hawker_hurricane
body:
The Hawker Hurricane was a British fighter aircraft built for the [[Royal Air Force]]. Serving alongside the contemporary [[Supermarine Spitfire]] in [[World War II]], this early monoplane was initially armed with 8 .303 [[browning m1919|Browning]] [[machine gun]]s in its wings. Later Hurricanes were commonly fitted with four 20mm cannons and could also carry a 500lb bomb under each wing (these earned the nickname "Hurribombers"). The Mk.IID version was an anti-tank model used extensively in Africa which sported 2x.303 machine guns loaded with tracers for aiming its 2x40mm anti-tank cannons.

The Sea Hurricane was a carrier-based variant. Some standard models were mounted on merchantmen with catapults and used for convoy protection.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hawker Hurricane":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawker_Hurricane

title: browning_m1919
body:
The [b]Browning M1919[/b] is a .30-06 caliber [[weapon]] developed by [[john moses browning|John M. Browning]] as an adaptation of the [[Browning M1917]] to an air-cooled, closed-bolt, [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] medium machine gun. It served as the main general-purpose machine gun of the United States military during [[World War II]] and the [[Korean War]] era. After the Lend-Lense Act was signed, many M1919's were re-chambered in the standard [[rifle cartridge]]s of other alllied nations' militaries. Famously, .303 caliber M1919s served as the main aircraft armament of the [[Supermarine Spitfire]] and [[Hawker Hurricane]] fighters, and other countries with their own industrial bases such as [[FN Herstal]] of [[Belgium]] were allowed to mass-produce their own M1919s under license.

The Browning M1919 is usually seen mounted as the fixed armament or movable turret on [[military vehicle|military]] [[aircraft]]s and [[ground vehicle]]s. In the infantry role, the early-war M1919A4 was used as a medium machine gun with a [[tripod]], though later in the war saw the development of the M1919A6 with a rifle stock and bipod in order to turn the weapon into a true [[light machine gun]]. It could also be picked up and fired from the hip in times of true need or desperation, though artistic depictions of this are usually references to [[Dr. Strangelove]].

In Anime, the weapon is connected most to [[Francesca Lucchini]] of [[Strike Witches]], though it is used by several other characters in the [[World Witches Series]] as well. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M1919A4 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M1919 browning machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1919_Browning_machine_gun
other_names: ブローニングM1919重機関銃

title: internet
body:
The Internet is the global system of interconnected [[computer]] networks that uses the Internet protocol suite (TCP/IP) to communicate between networks and devices.

This tag can be applied when a "generic" depiction of internets, such as web browser, social media, etc., appeared in the image.

h4. See Also
* [[egosearching]]
* [[social network]]

title: allen_wrench
body:
[b]Allen wrenches[/b] (also known as "hex keys") are small L-shaped hexagonal-prismatic steel bars that used as a [[wrench]] to loosen or tighten fasteners like [[bolt (hardware)|]]s or [[screw]]s  that have heads with internal hexagonal recesses (sockets).

h4. See also

* [[Impact wrench]]
* [[Socket wrench]]
* [[tools]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hex key":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hex_key]

title: pipe_wrench
body: A type of [[adjustable wrench]] designed to turn pipe fittings. Example: post #6481743. It can be identified by the adjustable jaw on top of the rest of [[wrench]], the teeth on both of its jaws, and It handle being colored red.

title: lug_wrench
body:
[b]Lug wrenches[/b] are a type of [[wrench]] that that have specifically-shaped holes (its "sockets") on their ends to physically fit a [[motor vehicle|vehicle]] wheel [[nut (hardware)|]]s (the wheel "lugs"), the fasteners used to hold the smaller parts of the wheel together in place, and are used to either loosen or tighten them.

A lug wrench can come as either L-shaped metal rod, or X-shaped piece, and may be considered as non-ratcheting [[socket wrench]], because they used special shaped holes can be [[socket (tool)|swappable]] with other pieces or not. A lug wrench may be confused with an tire lever by referring them as "tire iron''  a tool that used to separate the tire or hubcaps of the wheel that may be covering a wheel's lug nuts.

h4. See also

* [[Impact wrench]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Lug wrench":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lug_wrench

title: blaser_r93
body:
The [b]Blaser R93[/b] is a [[bolt action]] precision rifle offered in a multitude of calibers and barrel lengths manufactured by the German firearms manufacturer Blaser. it had a number of features rare on an typical hunting rifle, including a straight-pull cycling system and a proprietary Blaser saddle scope mount for mounting the optic directly to the quick-change barrel.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Blaser R93":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blaser_R93

title: beretta_px4
body:
The [b]Beretta px4[/b] is semi-automatic [[handgun]] that was manufactured by Beretta to compete with the [[glock]] brand. Its gun design consists of steel slide and polymer frame, It come in three sizes (full, compact, and subcompact) and three calibers (9x19 Parabelleum, .45 ACP, .40 S&W).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Beretta Px4 Storm":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beretta_Px4_Storm
* "Beretta: Px4 Family":https://www.beretta.com/en-us/firearms/by-gun-family/px4-storm-family

title: mannlicher_m1886
body:
Ferdinand Mannlicher's first straight-pull [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] that was designed in 1886, to serve as the standard infantry weapon for [[Austria-Hungary]]. The rifle was quickly made obsolete by the introduction of the Lebel Model 1886 rifle with its new smokeless cartridge. As such it was quickly replaced in Austrian service by more modern Mannlicher rifles, up to [[Mannlicher m1895]].

It used a wedge-lock straight pull action bolt. It was the first straight-pull bolt-action service rifle of any nation.

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Mannlicher M1886":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/mannlicher_m1886

body:

The rifle [[firing| fires]] the 8×56mmR in its 5-rounds, en-bloc [[clip (weapon) | clip]] and internal-magazine loading system, as its original predecessor weapon, the [[mannlicher m1886]]

title: martini-henry
body:
The [b]Martini-Henry[/b] is a single-shot [[lever action]] breech loading [[rifle]] that fires the .577/450 as its [[ammunition]] and was developed in 1870, as the main [[soldier|infantry]] weapon for [[army]] of the [[United kingdom|British]] empire, in many colonial wars of the late 19th century, until it was replaced by the [[lee-enfield|Lee-Metford]] in its roles, as 20th century began. Its name came from the two source: Friedrich von [b]Martini[/b], the Swiss designer who invented its lever-activated falling-block action, and Alexander [b]Henry[/b], the Scottish gunsmith who developed the weapon's [[rifling]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Martini-Henry (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[Trapdoor Springfield ]] The American counterpart to the Martini-Henry, as an single-shot rifle.
* [[Berdan rifle]] The Russian counterpart to the Martini-Henry, as an single-shot rifle.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Martini henry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martini–Henry
* "Powder and Lead: Martini henry":https://powderandlead.net/martini-henry/
other_names: マルティニ・ヘンリー銃

title: berdan_rifle
body:
The [b]Berdan rifle[/b] is a single-shot, breech-loaded [[rifle]] invented by American engineer Hiram Berdan and is chambered in 10.75×58mmR [[ammunition]]. It was the service rifle of the Imperial Russian Army from 1870 to 1891, and evetually replaced by [[Mosin-Nagant]]. 
This tag covers all the two variants: Berdan I which is a trapdoor breech block gun, and the [[bolt action]] Berdan II.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Martini-henry]] The British counterpart to the Berdan, as an single-shot rifle.
* [[Trapdoor Springfield]] The American counterpart to the Berdan, as an single-shot rifle.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Berdan rifle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berdan_rifle
* "Henry Krank.: M1870 Berdan rifle":https://www.henrykrank.com/the-m1870-berdan-rifle/

title: kamichama_karin
body:
Kamichama Karin is a fantasy shoujo manga about a 13-year old girl named [[Hanazono Karin]] who discovers that she has the hidden power of a goddess.

Infamous for its art style, which gives everyone [[very big eyes]]. One [[quality]] "image":https://media.japanesewithanime.com/images/175/sakuga-houkai-kamichama-karin.jpg/ of Karin in particular has been widely circulated and is mistakenly associated with [[Tsukimiya Ayu]]'s catchphrase "[[uguu~]]".

title: anya's_mother_(spy_x_family)
body:
A character from the backstory of the manga and anime [[Spy x Family]]. She was the biological mother of the main character [[Anya (spy x family)|]]. Judging by her wearing the same hospital gown as her daughter and expressing a desire to soar through the skies like a butterfly, she was likely imprisoned by the same scientists who experimented on Anya, inadvertently granting her the superpower of [[mind reading]].

From her limited appearances, she resembles an older Anya or [[Ashe (rengoku_no_ashe)|]] from [[Rengoku no Ashe]], another manga by [[Endou Tatsuya]].

title: putit
body:
The [[Elona]] version of the basic [[slime (substance)|]] monster, a direct reference to the [[slime_(Dragon_Quest)|iconic mascot characters]] of [[Dragon Quest]].

Like most slime monsters in RPGs that directly reference Dragon Quest, the standard types are some of the weakest monsters in the game, (although [[snail|snails]] are still weaker,) but more powerful palette-swap versions exist.

Putits are blue-gray and jelly bean-shaped with a pointy "tail", and have two black dot eyes.  They are otherwise featureless and often semi-transparent.

Unlike other games' slimes, putits are specifically listed as being loved by women in their game world, as their "meat" is considered "great for the skin", and eating a putit corpse gives massive training to charisma.  Players often ranch putits for this reason.

Elona+ putits and slimes can be evolved into [[slime girl]]s if female, or [[roper|ropers]] if male.

title: strapless_dress
body:
A [[dress]] that has no shoulder straps, attached sleeves, [[halterneck]] or other shoulder- or collarbone-related attire holding up the upper portion of the dress, instead relying on the tightness of the dress (usually around the hip or waist area) to keep it in place. The shoulders and upper chest area should be [[bare shoulders|bare]], which also implies the lack of a strapped [[bra]].

Strapless dresses must [b]not[/b] cover the shoulders or arms in any way outside of separate articles of clothing or jewelry such as [[detached sleeves]], [[gloves]], or [[armlet]]s.


Strapless dresses, [[sleeveless dress]]es, and [[off-shoulder dress]]es are mutually exclusive to each other.


h4. Correct examples

* !post #7404412
* !post #6552983: A strapless dress worn with [[elbow gloves]]
* !post #5904407: A strapless dress worn with [[detached sleeves]]
* !post #3359469: A strapless dress that has a [[bra]] worn underneath
* !post #7496980: A strapless dress worn over a [[shirt]]
* !post #9221044: A strapless dress (black) worn over a [[sleeveless]] outfit (grey)

h4. Incorrect examples
Do not tag [[off-shoulder dress]]es as "strapless dress".
* !post #7930228
* !post #7249221
* !post #7108025
* !post #3507146
* !post #8001840

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
* [[Sleeveless dress]]
other_names: ベアトップワンピース

title: halo_installation
body:
A series of seven [[Ringworld]]-like space stations found in the [i][[Halo (series)|Halo]][/i] series. Numbered as Installation 01 to 07 and dotted throughout the Milky Way galaxy, these stations contain very similar and recognizable architecture all throughout, and a human-habitable surface on the interior side of the ring with a number of different biomes. There are no fauna inhabiting those biomes, only flora, and each station is tended to by an AI caretaker. Additionally, outside the galaxy, there is the star-shaped Installation 00 that is much larger than the other Installations and can manufacture and position new Installations in place of any that are destroyed.

This tag can apply to the more straightforward depiction of an Installation from outside, or to the [[atmospheric perspective]] effect where the surface's upwards curve causes the entire station to be observable in the sky.

title: impasto
body:
A painting technique where paint is laid on an area of the surface thickly, usually thick enough that the brush or painting-knife strokes are visible. Paint can also be mixed right on the canvas. When dry, impasto provides texture; the paint appears to be coming out of the canvas.

The technique is commonly achieved with [[oil painting (medium)|oil]] or [[acrylic paint (medium)|acrylic paint]] due to their thicker consistency.

Can be synonymous with [[impressionism]], the difference being the depth of the paint

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Impasto":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impasto]

title: eyes_in_shadow
body:
When the eyes of someone or something stand out (can be seen) while the area surrounding the eyes are covered in shadows that completely obscure all details. Think "glowing eyes peering out of a cave" level of darkness.

Often goes along with [[face in shadow]]. [[Why dis ninja look so mad (meme)]] is a notable example.

Not to be confused with [[shaded face]], [[no eyes]], or [[hair over eyes]].

h4. Examples

* !post #9165569
* !post #8051887

h4. Non-examples

* !post #8825787: [[no eyes]]
* !post #9025904: [[shaded face]]: shadowed without a tangible light source

h4. See Also

* [[Eyed silhouette]]
* [[Face in shadow]]
* [[Glowing eye]]
* [[Glowing eyes]]
* [[Mouth in shadow]]

title: dragon_ball_z_dokkan_battle
body:
A mobile gacha game produced by Bandai Namco and Akatsuki and released for iOS and Android in 2015. It features many characters from across the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise, from the original manga to the largely Arcade-exclusive [[Dragon Ball Heroes]].

Use this tag for official art from the game, fan art which uses the game's card style, or art which references elements from the game, whether it be exclusive moves or in-game events, or from the community.

title: super_saiyan_4
body:
A form of [[Super Saiyan]] that originally appeared in the anime-only [[Dragon Ball GT]]. Born from gaining control over the [[Golden Oozaru]] form, its main features are red fur covering the torso, longer hair, red lining around the eyes, and the addition of a [[monkey tail]] even if the user already had them cut beforehand.

[[Son Goku]] is the first to achieve this form, followed by [[Vegeta]] and their fusion, [[Gogeta]] (whose Super Saiyan 4 form is different from his fusees, since his hair turns [[red hair|red]] and his body gains brown fur instead). It can be upgraded into [[Super Full Power Saiyan 4]].

[[Dragon Ball Heroes]] would later introduce a further evolution to this form, with the long name of [[Super Full Power Saiyan 4 Limit Breaker]].

The form would be canonized with its appearance in [[Dragon Ball DAIMA]], though appearance-wise it would see some changes, such as rendering the hair in the same color as the fur, and the arms and hands getting proportionally larger per GT's original concepts.

title: action_movie_fx_(meme)
body:
An app for Apple devices released in 2011 allowing you to overlay various action movie VFX over self recorded video.

One of the most recognizable, and probably overused effects, is "Side-Swiped" where a car is hit from the side by a [[police car]].

The app (and stock videos) later gained resurgences around 2023 as a part of various ironic shitpost [[meme]] videos, often without removing the [[green screen]] for comedic effect.

title: nero_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional manned military giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Sentinel]].
 
[b]MSA-007 Nero[/b]

An Anaheim Electronics mass production version of the [[S Gundam]] with an upper body superstructure based on that of the Lambda Gundam prototype. The result is a high-performance mass production model potentially capable of rivaling higher-class [[mobile suit]]s with proper tuning. 

The design of Nero was also inspired by another of [[Anaheim Electronics]]' mass production mobile suits, the MSA-003 [[nemo_(mobile_suit)|Nemo]].

title: daizyuzin
body:
The combined form of the Five Guardian Beasts in [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]], better known to American viewers as the [[Dino Megazord]]. Daizyuzin is a sentient super robot that can actually speak, unlike the Dino Megazord, which is merely a mecha.

While Daizyuzin would return many times after Zyuranger in crossovers, his appearance in [[No.1 Sentai Gozyuger]], wearing a [[cloak]], garnered a lot of attention due to how cool he looked. Additionally, the show would see the first appearance of the merch-exclusive Black Daizyuzin.

title: laundry_cart
body:
A laundry cart is a [[cart]] for transporting laundry to and from the washer, dryer, folding table, ironing station, etc.  Most laundry room and [[laundromat]] carts will be small metal carts similar to a [[shopping cart]], but usually without the handle and may feature an elevated bar to hang clothes from.  Larger carts or trucks featuring a large canvas baskets may be used in places like a hotel where lots of clothes and/or linen have to be laundered.

* !post #4454677

She has [[Long Hair]], [[Thighhighs]], [[Medium Breasts]] and uses [[Anti-Materiel Rifle]] similar to [[Barrett M82]] in combat.

body:
Minor character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. 

Former lieutenant of USE's military force who was investigating the system's corruption after being falsely accused by [[Gallerian Marlon]]. He also is a major member of the Tasan party, the younger brother of [[Gammon Octo]] and the lover or [[Nemesis Sudou]]. [Spoilers]Eventually he found his demise at hands of a regretful Nemesis while researching a series of murders in the Rolled city, which triggered at Gallerian and PN to order a hit on him. body:

Can still overlap with [[faceless]], [[eyes in shadow]] and [[mouth in shadow]].

h4. Examples

title: forklift
body:
A forklift (also called lift truck, jitney, fork truck, fork hoist, and forklift truck) is a powered industrial truck used to lift and move materials over short distances.

Please refer to this "helpful guide on forklift safety to learn more":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ChOHnSL7ZCg&t=16s]

h4. See also

* [[Pallet jack]]

title: cargo_pallet
body: A type of flat-bedded structure, typically made of wood, used to aid in loading cargo via [[forklift]]s, [[crane (machine)|cranes]], or [[pallet jack]]s. They typically have distinct patterns of wooden boards on top, with holes in the side for the forks of a forklift to slide into.

title: pallet_jack
body:
A pallet jack, also known as a pallet truck or pallet pump, is the most basic form of [[forklift]] designed to slightly raise [[cargo pallet]]s and move them.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pallet jack":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pallet_jack]

title: glint
body:
The sparkle of a polished or metal object. This should come from a physical object, such as [[jewelry]], a [[sword]], or [[teeth]].

[[Sparkle]], [b]glint[/b], and [[diffraction spikes]] all refer to similar patterns of bright lines radiating from a point. They are not clearly differentiated, and usage tends to be context-sensitive. In general:
* [[Sparkle]] is considered the base case. Usually four lines at right angles radiating from a point. Associated with eyes, liquid or particulate matter (e.g. raindrops, snow, sand), or nothing (appearing mid-air). Can appear in large numbers.
* [b]Glint[/b] is associated with solid objects, especially ones which are metallic and/or sharp. Usually appear singly or in small numbers.
* [[Diffraction spikes]] is the technical term for the phenomenon in general, but is used less often. Can be used for more realistic-looking effects or conversely when appearing extremely large and exaggerated. More likely than sparkle and glint to be asymmetric or to have more than four radiating lines.

h4. See also

* [[bokeh]]
* [[lens flare]]
* [[light particles]]

title: mouth_in_shadow
body:
When the mouth of someone or something stand out (can be seen) while the area surrounding the mouth is covered in shadows that completely obscure all details.

Often goes along with [[face in shadow]].

BR is a very unique event compared to other comic events, besides being carried out for a long period of time, participants are also given convenience by the scenario provided by the committee. title: transcendent_blazer
body:
An original attack for [[Gogeta]] that originates from the game [[Dragon Ball Z Dokkan Battle]]. 

He crosses his arms, forming a [[Galick Gun|veil of golden ki]] over his right hand and a [[Kamehameha (Dragon Ball)|sphere of blue energy]] in his left, before bringing his arms together above his head, causing the two energies to merge into a tumultuous mass of yellow and blue light. Finally, Gogeta thrusts his arms forward to launch the devastating blast, completely annihilating the victim with its force. Most fanart represents this attack with the first part with his crossed arms.

title: cleopatra_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s depiction of Cleopatra VII, one of the last pharaoh of [[ancient Egyptian|ancient Egypt]] from the Greek Ptolemaic dynasty. Best known for her intimate relationships with [[Gaius Julius Caesar (fate)|]] and Mark Anthony, her legend surrounding her beauty, and her struggle to keep Egypt independent from Rome's rule. She first appeared in the [[Halloween Comeback!]] event.

Cleopatra is depicted as a bright and fashionable woman, evident by her [[contemporary]] clothing in her first two ascensions. When it comes to her past relationships, Cleopatra does not have any romantic feelings towards Anthony and views him as a good friend, while she still retains her love for Caesar and is in a [[husband and wife]] relationship with him.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Komatsuzaki Rui]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kugimiya Rie]]

title: macross_plus
body:
[b][i]Macross Plus[/i][/b] (マクロスプラス) is a 1994 [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] OVA series set in the [[Macross]] universe, directed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] and Watanabe Shinichirou and written by Nobumoto Keiko, with music by [[Kanno Youko]].

The story takes place in 2040, decades after the original [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|Super Dimension Fortress Macross]]. On the planet Eden, three former childhood friends are reunited during a military project to determine a new [[variable fighter]] successor, and old grudges and past traumas resurface.

The series was released in 1994 in [[Japan]] on home video spread across four episodes, and also saw release in North America and Europe courtesy of Manga Entertainment. A theatrical cut of the series was also released in theaters in 1995 under the name [i]Macross Plus: Movie Edition[/i].

h4. See also

* [[Isamu Dyson]]
* [[Guld Goa Bowman]]

* [[Ghost Drone]]
* [[VA-3]]

title: irisviel_von_einzbern_(caster)
body:
[[Irisviel von Einzbern]] as a Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This tag can also be used for her other appearances wearing the [[Dress of Heaven]].

[spoiler]Is the source of the singularity in the [[Fate/Accel Zero Order]] event because of her designation as the master of [[Saber (fate)|]] and the Greater Grail. After the Order's climax, she joins the Chaldea security organization.[/spoiler]

She uses the [[Dress of Heaven]] and specializes in healing and support abilities in-game.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]

title: dragon_quest
body:
An immensely popular Japanese RPG series developed by [[Square Enix]]—formerly by Enix separately—with character designs by [[Toriyama Akira]]. The series—especially the earliest games—heavily influenced the development of the genre in Japan. The series was never as popular in the west as [i][[Final Fantasy]][/i] due to delayed releases and the closure of Enix's North America office in the 1990s, but its profile has grown since the 2003 Square Enix merger.

Formerly known as [i]Dragon Warrior[/i] in North America until 2005, due to a trademark conflict over a tabletop roleplaying game of the same name.

h4. Games

title: viola_(bayonetta)
body:
A playable character introduced in [[Bayonetta 3]]. A young witch-in-training from an [[Alternate universe]], she arrives to [[Bayonetta]]'s universe to help her fight against [b]Singularity[/b], the main antagonist in the 3rd game. 

Viola is later revealed as [spoilers]the daughter of her universe's Bayonetta and [[Luka Redgrave]][/spoilers]. In battle Viola uses a [[katana]] and her demon cat familiar, Cheshire.

title: malyuk
body:
Ukrainian bullpup [[assault rifle]] derived from the [[Kalashnikov rifle]] platform. Also known as the AS "Vulcan" in the military of Ukraine.

It is offered in either 7.62x39mm, using common [[AK-47]] magazines, or 5.45x39mm, using the same magazines as the [[AK-74]] and [[AK-74M]].

title: pudding
body:
In the United States, pudding characteristically denotes a sweet [[milk]]-based [[dessert]] similar in consistency to egg-based custards, though it may also refer to other types such as bread and rice pudding.

In Japan, the "crème caramel":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cr%C3%A8me_caramel variety is the most common. Packaged varieties are sold throughout Japanese convenience stores under the name purin (プリン), or custard pudding. The Spanish word for this dessert, [i]flan[/i], often leads artists to make visual puns involving [[Flandre Scarlet]].

h4. See also

* [[custard]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* [[pudding a la mode]]

title: tennoji_rina
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. She's extremely shy and has trouble expressing her emotions, often covering her face with a [[sketchbook]] (dubbed the "[[Rina-chan Board]]") containing a [[drawing (object)|]] of her face. She has a pet robot cat named [[Aran (love live!)|]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[blunt ends]], [[kishimen hair]] and an [[ahoge]]. Rather than her uniform blazer, she wears a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[sleeves past fingers]] and always carries a [[marker]] in her pocket.

Her birthday is November 13, 2001.

She is a member of [[QU4RTZ (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Tanaka Chiemi]].

h4. Appearance

title: ump45_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP45]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Has [[grey hair|grey]]-[[brown hair|dull-brown hair]] worn with [[one side up]], and wears a fairly practical (by fictional standards) outfit consisting of a [[white shirt]], a [[jacket]], [[black pantyhose]] and exoskeleton. She has [[brown eyes]] and has a [[scar across eye|scar on the left eye]].

UMP45 is portrayed as the older sister of [[UMP9 (girls' frontline)|]], sister (mostly young) of [[UMP40 (girls' frontline)|]], and is the leader of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]]. UMP45 is often portrayed in the fandom as being the butt of [[flat chest]] jokes, often from either UMP9 or [[M37 (girls' frontline)|]]. Would receive a [[UMP45 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In her appearance in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], she would go by the name [[Leva (Girls' Frontline 2)|]].

Her original illustrator [[Infukun]] adapted her design from one of [[Renatus.Z]]'s Pixiv Fantasia characters, [[Renatus (pixiv fantasia)|]] (hence why they are credited as ZAGALA). Following Infukun's departure, other illustrators have picked her up to do her skins. She was previously voiced by Mineuchi Tomomi until she retired from voice acting in December 31, 2022 and is currently voiced by [[Sasahara Yuu]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3991946: [[UMP45 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|MOD3]]

title: youkai_fox_(wild_and_horned_hermit)
body:
A shapeshifting [[fox]] youkai which impersonated [[kirisame_marisa|Marisa]] in [[Wild and Horned Hermit]] episodes 8 and 30. 

She shared in activities with "Kuda-gitsune":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuda-gitsune], a small fox familiar spirit used by "Izuna-tsukai":[http://eos.kokugakuin.ac.jp/modules/xwords/entry.php?entryID=193]. It is unknown whether she herself is the kudagistune, or the owner of it. 

Not to be confused with the other [[Youkai Fox_(forbidden_scrollery)|]], who impersonated a human child in [[Forbidden Scrollery]].

title: isamu_dyson
body:
A character from the [[MACROSS]] series. He is the main protagonist of the [[Macross Plus]] OVA from the 90s.

[b]Isamu Alva Dyson[/b] is a very skilled -but hot-headed and cocky- [[U.N. Spacy]] [[variable fighter]] ace and prototype [[mecha]] test [[pilot]]. His mecha of choice are the [[VF-11]] and the [[YF-19]] variable fighters.

The character is voiced by "Bryan Cranston":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bryan_Cranston ([i]Malcolm in the Middle[/i], [i]Breaking Bad[/i]) in the American dub of the OVA. Cranston also voiced [[Marty Tohn]] in the anime [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]].
other_names: イサム・アルヴァ・ダイソン

title: n.u.n.s.
body:
The [b]New U.N. Spacy[/b] is the name of the successor to the original [[U.N. Spacy]] organization from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]].

According to the fictional [[Macross]] chronology, since the end of Space War I (2009 A.D. - 2010 A.D.) until the latest animated series, [[Macross Frontier]] (2059 A.D.), the original U.N. Spacy was reorganized into the "New U.N. Spacy" or N.U.N.S.

This new organization functions as a [[space]] [[military]] defense force that is in charge of the protection of all the different colonization fleets of the Human and cultured Zentradi alliance and the [[planet]]s they have colonized across the [[galaxy]]. 

The New U.N. Spacy now has a much bigger space navy composed mostly of military bases established on those planets as well as several defense fleets scattered among the colonization fleets. Each defense fleet is composed mostly of improved Human and [[Zentradi]] capital [[spacecraft]], new variable fighters and other mecha and at least one [[SDF-1]] sized vessel used as command base for the current fleet.

h4. See also

title: digimon_world_3
body: Digimon World 3 (デジモンワールド3 新たなる冒険の扉, Dejimon Wārudo 3 Aratanaru Bōken no Tobira, Digimon World 3: The Door of a New Adventure), also known as Digimon World 2003 in Europe and Australia, is a role-playing video game for the [[PlayStation]] developed by BEC and Boom Corp, and published by Bandai. It is the third installment in the [[Digimon World]] series and it was first released in June 2002 in North America and then in July 2002 in Japan and November 2002 in Europe. The game tells the story of Junior, who begins playing an MMORPG called "Digimon Online" with his friends, but when terrorists attack, Junior and the other players are trapped within the game and must find a way out using his [[Digimon]] partners.

title: yagiyama_yotsuyu
body:
Yotsuyu Yagiyama (八木山 夜露, Yagiyama Yotsuyu) is a secondary antagonist featured in the eighth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[JoJolion]]. 

Yotsuyu is revealed to be a [spoilers]Rock Human with a stolen name, belonging to a Locacaca Organization.[/spoilers]. Yotsuyu is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user who wields the Stand [[I Am a Rock (stand)|]]

Yagiyama is a Rock Human of slim build and average to above-average height. He has shoulder-length, straight black hair with short bangs. His eyes are black with small triangular highlights.
He wears a headpiece of [[leaves]] and a collar with a pin bearing the letter H. His arms, stomach, and legs are clad in a dark, leathery material studded with small metallic spikes. Over this, he wears a crop top and a pair of floral-printed bloomers. Attached to his belt is a small pouch.

title: pyotr_illyich_tchaikovsky
body: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky was a Russian composer during the Romantic period. He was the first Russian composer whose music made a lasting impression internationally. Tchaikovsky wrote some of the most popular concert and theatrical music in the classical repertoire, including the ballets Swan Lake and The Nutcracker, the 1812 Overture, his First Piano Concerto, Violin Concerto, the [[Romeo and Juliet]] Overture-Fantasy, several symphonies, and the opera Eugene Onegin.

title: faust_(project_wingman)
body:
The main antagonist of the Frontline-59 campaign DLC from [[Project Wingman]]. 

A ruthless and a win-at-all-costs leader, she serves as one of the commanding officers of the Cascadian Independence Force's invasion of the Federation Core States territory of Magadan. [spoilers]Eventually, her true nature was revealed, in which she seeks to destroy the Pacific Federation as a means of salvation for Cascadia and the world, regardless of the cost. After going rogue with her followers, she met her demise under the hands of [[Driver_(Project Wingman)|]] and Division K-9.[/spoilers]

title: rick_dias_ii
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]MSA-099-2 Rick Dias II[/b]

It is an evolution of the legendary [[Rick Dias]] [[AEUG]] [[mobile suit]] from [[Zeta Gundam|The Gryps War]].

title: full_armor_hyaku_shiki_kai
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]FA-100S Full Armor Hyaku Shiki Kai[/b]

A variant of the MSR-00100 [[Hyaku Shiki Kai]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] equipped with additional heavy armor. 

Although its mobility is reduced by the added weight of the Full Armor system, it has an assortment of built-in armaments, including missiles, explosive bolts and additional powerful beam weaponry.

title: hyaku_shiki_kai
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]MSR-00100S Hyaku Shiki Kai[/b]

An improved variant of the MSN-00100 [[Hyaku Shiki]] [[mobile_suit|MS]]. 

Modifications include improved flexible wing binders and more powerful thrusters. It also features grenade launchers built into the forearms and optional shoulder-mounted weapons such as a beam Gatling gun and pulse laser gun.

title: geymalk
body:
A fictional manned giant combat [[robot]] from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] anime TV series from 1986.

[b]AMX-015 Geymalk[/b]

A heavy assault and psycommu equipped Newtype use [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. In addition to being equiped with mega-particle guns all over its body, it possessed two [[funnels_(gundam)|"mother funnels"]] with 28 total [[bit_(gundam)|bit remote weapons]] between them. 

This overwhelming firepower made the Geymalk perhaps the most heavily armed and dangerous suit produced by Axis during the First Neo Zeon War. While it was intended to have been mass produced, only one unit was ever built and given to [[Chara Soon]].

title: rezel
body:
A fictional variable  geometry [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]RGZ-95 ReZEL[/b]

A high-performance transformable [[Mobile Suit]] fielded by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]]. By utilizing the [[AEUG]] [[Methuss]]'s simplified transformation mechanism as a base, and integrating it with lessons learned from the [[Z II Gundam]] and the [[Zeta Plus]] series of MS as well as increasing parts commonality with the tried and proven [[Jegan]] made the ReZEL (short for [b]Re[/b]fined [b]Z[/b]eta [b]E[/b]scort [b]L[/b]eader) both highly competent and cheap enough to enter mass production. 

The type was effective in combat, and served as both a booster for the Jegans, who could grab onto ReZELs and fly with them to save fuel, and as a very powerful MS on its own, with a new design beam rifle that emulated the Zeta Gundam's (even able to generate a beam saber blade) and options of additional armament via the Defenser backpacks. 

The uprated [[ReZEL Commander Type]], distingushable from the rank and file ReZELs by its visor and sensors (red in the base model, green in the Commander Types) further pushed the already formidable performance of the unit. It was the EFF's first mass produced, widely operated transformable MS.

title: tai_yuan_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Chinese (ex-Russian) destroyer [i]Tai Yuan[/i] (pennant 104) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Shenbei Xiaoqiu]], voiced by [[Mizuhashi Kaori]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[purple eyes]], blue-colored scales on the side of her uniform, and a white [[snake]] wrapped around her right leg, reflective of her theme motif as the Black Chimera/Genbu of the class. 

Her [[rigging]] contains two 130 mm single gun mounts and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]].

Her real-life destroyer counterpart was originally built for the Soviet Pacific Fleet before being sold to China in 1953 (albeit initially named [i]Jilin[/i]) before being relieved of active service in 1991 to act as a stationary training ship.

title: fart
body:
The emission or flatus of gas inside the [[intestines]] from the [[ass]]/[[anus]]. Also known as a big part of toilet humor and even as a Japanese cultural phenomenon dating back to the Heian period. When He-gassen 屁合戦 was a common competition. Most common art depictions are illustrated with characters eating a [[sweet_potato]]. As it’s a classic gag of such an occurrence after eating them.

h4.See also
* [[smell]]

title: manazuru_chitose
body:

She and her servant Lucius Longinus won the [[Holy Grail (fate)|]] War 14 years ago and became the creator of Mosaic City, in addition to setting up the Holy Grail to distribute itself amongst the hearts of humans, allowing every human to summon their own servant.

title: dent
body:
A dent is a hollow in the surface of an object which has been caused by hitting, blunt impact or pressing it. 

h1. See also

* [[Bonk]]
* [[Crack]]
* [[Damaged]]
* [[Scratches]]

title: bonk
body:
A character being hit over the head in a comedic manner and/or accompanied by the eponymous sound effect. Sometimes resulting in a [[dent|dented]] head.

The purpose is often to dissuade the character from some course of action, or to punish them after the fact, but this is not necessary to qualify as a bonk. Likewise, the most common implement is a [[baseball bat]], but it can be any object or even bare-handed.

h4. See also

* [[>_<]]: common facial expression of the recipient of a bonk
* [[Dent]]
* [[Horny jail (meme)]]

title: gwechul
body: [b]괴담에 떨어져도 출근을 해야 하는구나[/b] (Lit: [i]Even if you fell into a ghost story, you still have to go to work[/i]), often abbreviated as 괴담출근 / GDCG or 괴출 / Gwechul, is a Korean fiction webnovel by DS.Back that tells the story of Kim Soleum who must enter various Ghost Stories in order to return to his world. It has horror elements and is rated 15+.

title: buddha's_temptation_(food)
body: Buddha's Temptation, also known as Fushouquan, is a famous dish from Fuzhou, Fujian Province, China. This dish was developed during the Daoguang period of the Qing Dynasty by Zheng Chunfa, the owner of the Juchun Garden restaurant in Fuzhou.

title: crimson_codex_(fate)
body:
A supporting character in [[Fate/Samurai Remnant]]. A sentient [[grimoire|magical tome]] that floats in the air and speaks like a human. [[Miyamoto Iori (fate)|]] inherited him from his [[Miyamoto Musashi (Male) (fate)|adoptive father]]. He is an ancient Western book who taught Iori magecraft and recognized [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (Lancer) (fate)|Lancer]]'s face upon first seeing her, though he initially couldn't place her identity.

He appears as a leather-bound book with two eyes and a mouth lined up vertically.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wataru Rei]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Chafurin]]

* "TYPE-MOON Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Crimson_Codex

title: rpg_(weapon)
body:
[b]RPG[/b], short for [i]ручной противотанковый гранатомёт/Ruchnoy Protivotankovy Granatomyot[/i] in Russian, which translates to "hand-held anti-tank grenade launcher", refers to a hand-held [[weapon]] originally developed to destroy [[tank]]s and [[bunker]]s and comes in a variety of shapes, designs, purposes, and types. Although the [[RPG-7]] is the poster-child for the weapon, it is far from being the only type of RPG in the world.

It is commonly known under the backronym [i]Rocket-Propelled Grenade[/i] in the [[united states|United States]] even though not all of the designs are rocket-propelled.

This tag is intended to be used for describing [[rocket launcher]]s that has strong resemblance with the popular RPG-7, regardless of specified designated name. [b]Do not use[/b] this for role-playing games or ugly glasses (called "rape-prevention goggles" in the US military).

h4. See also

* [[Explosives]]
* [[Rocket Launcher]]
* [[Panzerfaust]]
* [[M1 Bazooka]]
* [[RPG-1]]
* [[RPG-2]] - Predecessor of the famous RPG-7
* [[RPG-29]]
* [[RPG-7]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: pussy_pump
body:
A device which applies suction to female genitalia. It usually consists of a cup or cylinder that fits over the vaginal area connected to a hand-operated or motorized pump mechanism that sucks the air from the cup. The design aims to boost blood flow to the vaginal area, thereby enhancing sensitivity and potentially elevating the pleasure of the sexual experience.

See also [[clitoris pump]]

title: breast_pump
body:
A device designed to assist in lactation among [i]human[/i] mothers for the purpose of filling bottles with milk for their children using suction.  

[[Milking machine]] is a more generic term for devices to induce lactation among any animal.  All breast pumps are milking machines, but if it is not for humans, (such as the especially popular cow milking machine) it's not a breast pump, but is a milking machine.  

Post #1715415 is an example of a breast pump. Post #97533 is a generic milking machine.

h4. Body Suction Devices
* [[breast enlargement pump]] (a similar device designed for a different purpose)
* [[pussy pump]]
* [[clitoris pump]]
* [[milking machine]]
* [[penis pump]]

[u]Use this tag when:[/u]

title: nukumizu_kazuhiko
body:
One of the main characters of the anime [[Make heroine ga oo sugiru!]]
Character Traits: [[Black hair]] [[Brown eyes]] 
The protagonist of the series. He is a first-year high school student who is a loner with a philosophical personality and an otaku fond of reading light novels. He witnesses the girls being rejected by their crushes and decides to emotionally support them and help them move on, though at times, their antics tend to annoy him beyond belief.
Birthday: December 25

title: komari_chika
body:
One of the main characters of the anime [[Make heroine ga oo sugiru!]]
Character Traits: [[Red hair]] [[Yellow eyes]] 
A shy and insecure girl who tries to avoid communicating with people. However, in the circle of friends she becomes more open and talkative. She is a member of a literary club
Birthday: March 29
Height: 148 cm
Weight: 41 kg

title: nanashi_mumei_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Nanashi Mumei]].

It consists of a [[brown capelet|brown]] [[hooded capelet]] secured by a [[brown bowtie]] and a longer [[two-sided cape]] that splits like feathers, a [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[three-quarter sleeves|forearm length sleeves]], an [[underbust]] [[brown corset]], [[archery shooting glove]]s, a [[belt]] with a [[lantern]], a [[belt pouch|pouch]], and a small [[sheathed]] [[dagger]] hanging from it, a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[single thighhigh|a thighhigh sock]] on her left leg, [[single kneehigh|a kneehigh sock]] on her right leg, and [[brown boots|brown]] [[ankle boots]].

Her main hairstyle here is [[very long hair|long hair]] in a [[split ponytail]], held in place with a [[feather hair ornament|feather hair tie]]. Her bangs are secured by a rune-shaped [[hairclip]].

title: despair
body:
Crushing sorrow, broken spirit, the feeling that all hope is lost. For characters that display emotional turmoil much greater than simple [[sad|sadness]].

Not to be confused with [[traumatized|traumatization]], [[humiliation]], [[shame]], or [[embarrassed|embarrassment]]. Keep in mind that including over-simplified "chibi" expressions such as "-A-" might dilute the meaning of the tag.

title: annoyed
body:
Mild anger, often caused by another's repeated troublesome actions. Annoyed characters will often appear tired or exasperated from having to endure another's antics and may show a [[squiggle]].

Distinct from [[angry|anger]] and [[furious|fury]]; use this tag when the level of frustration a character is experiencing is relatively minor.

h4. See also

* [[Angry]]
* [[Anger vein]]
* [[Excalibur face]]
* [[Furious]]
* [[Disgust]]
* [[Glaring]]
* [[Frown]]
* [[Pout]]
* [[Squiggle]]
** [[Spoken squiggle]]
* [[V-shaped eyebrows]]
* [[Tag Group:Face tags]]

body:
[[Invincible (series)|]] character.

[b]Conquest[/b] is a savage, brutal Viltrumite warrior who, true to his name, enjoys crushing his enemies and bringing entire planets to their knees. Considered brutal even by Viltrumite standards, he has become an outcast amongst his people, who only see him as a tool for destroying rebellious worlds.

Conquest is a broad, [[muscular]] Viltrumite who wears the traditional grey and white Viltrumite uniform. He has [[grey hair]] and a [[mustache]], while possessing a [[scar]] over his right eye and a [[prosthetic arm|prosthetic]] right arm.

title: oleg_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Russian cruiser [i]Oleg[/i]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes|bluish]]-[[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] top, [[black panties|black]] [[highleg panties]], [[black pantyhose]], [[off shoulder]] [[white coat|white]] [[fur-trimmed coat]], and [[goggles on head|goggles]] on her head. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two mechanical hull pieces, one of which contains her two twin 152 mm gun mounts.

title: siris_(infinity_blade)
body:
Siris is the main protagonist of the [[Infinity Blade]] series. He is the last and greatest in a long line of fathers and sons honoring the Tradition of the Sacrifice. Siris was raised as a warrior in his hometown of Drem's Maw until he matured, at which time he was sent to face the God King in ritual combat like his ancestors before him.


https://infinityblade.fandom.com/wiki/Siris

title: four_beasts_(nikke)
body:
A group in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. The group consists of [[Behemoth (nikke)|]], [[Leviathan (nikke)|]], [[Ziz (nikke)|]], and Bahamut.

A subgroup of [[Heretics (nikke)|]] that follows a different agenda from their kin though they aren't aligned with mankind by any means. They seek to find the means to achieve their vengeance against the Offsprings who look down on, dismiss, or ignore them.; They are all named after primeval chaos-monsters from biblical texts.

title: behemoth_(nikke)
body:
An NPC from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A heretic and member of [[Four Beasts (nikke)|the Four Beasts]] along with [[Leviathan (nikke)|]], [[Ziz (nikke)|]], and Bahamut.

Unlike the other heretics, Behemoth is surprisingly friendly. That doesn't make her any less of a threat, though.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], and [[medium breasts]]. She has [[red eyes]], [[Black lips|black]] [[Lipstick]], [[Black Eyeliner]], and [[sharp teeth]], and two [[horns]] on one side of her head. She also have [[Black nails|black]] [[nail polish]], [[finger tattoo|finger tattoos]] [[ring|rings]], and [[spiked ear piercing|spiked ear piercings]]. She also use dark matter to make her outfit that consists of a two-piece [[black bodysuit]] that exposes her [[navel]] and [[pubic tattoo]].
other_names: ベヒーモス(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: hammer_and_sickle
body:
[b]The [[hammer]] and [[sickle]][/b] is a part of communist symbolism and its usage indicates an association with [[Communism]], a Communist party, or a Communist state. It symbolizes the unity of peasants and workers.

Although it is a universal symbol for communism, it is typically associated with the [[Soviet]] Union due to being the first country that adopted the symbol.

Nowadays the usage of the Hammer and Sickle has been banned in certain Nations, only the use of it is allowed in arts.

This tag is for the original hammer and sickle symbol, for various derivative or a parody of the symbol such as the [[pravda (emblem)|]] emblem, use their respective tags instead.

h4. See also

* [[Soviet flag]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hammer and sickle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hammer_and_sickle

title: twitter_rabbit_ears_(meme)
body:
A [[Twitter]] [[meme]] featuring rabbit ears attached to the image from the caption.

[quote][code]
⠀⢀⡤⣄⡀
⢠⡏⠀⠀⠳⡄⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣀⣀⣀
⢸⠃⠀⠀⠀⢿⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣼⠃⠀⠘⢧
⢸⡆⠀⠀⠀⠸⡆⠀⠀⠀⣸⠃⠀⠀⠀⠈⢧
⠈⣇⠀⠀⠀⠀⣧⠀⠀⠀⡏⠀⢦⠀⠀⠀⠸⡆
⠀⠀⢹⡀⠀⠀⢸⠀⠀⢸⠇⠀⠘⢧⡀⠀⣸⠃
⠀⠀⠀⢳⠀⠀⢸⡆⠀⢸⠀⠀⠀⣼⠙⠋⠁
[/code][/quote]

Usually, a character's head is cropped towards the top left of the image, since Twitter displays captions above images. This effect currently does not display correctly on Danbooru.

h4. See also

* [[Twitter Sparkles]]
* [[Twitter Suki]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Twitter Bunny Ears Trend":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/twitter-bunny-ears-trend]

title: zaku_machinery
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Walpurgis]].

[b]MS-11R Zaku Machinery[/b]

A newly-constructed modernized variant of the [[Act Zaku]] MS developed by [[Neo Zeon]] in U.C. 0089. 

Although it seems simplistic in comparison to other [[mobile_suit|MS]] units of the same era, it is remarkably versatile with high standards in terms of basic performance similar to the future [[Geara Doga]].

h4. See also
* [[Zaku Machinery Ernardo Custom]]

title: zaku_machinery_ernardo_custom
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Walpurgis]].

[b]MS-11RS Zaku Machinery Ernardo Custom[/b]

A high performance officer variant of the [[Zaku Machinery]] [[mobile suit]] developed for [[Ernardo Bat]]. 

It is covered in advanced gold colored beam resistant coating (like the [[Hyaku Shiki]]) and is armed with a long distance [[beam rifle]].

title: shota
body:
[[howto:rate|Sexually explicit]] or [[sexually suggestive]] artwork of boys who appear to be preadolescent (roughly between the age of 3 to 12). It's a purely visual tag, so the character's canonical age doesn't matter.

Work-safe, non-sexual artwork of young boys should not be tagged as [[shota]]. Use [[child]] or [[age difference]] instead. If you are not sure whether a post should be tagged as shota, ask in the "loli / shota check thread":[/forum_topics/8650].

This is a [[help:censored tags|censored tag]], which requires a "Gold+ Account":/user_upgrades/new to view.

h4. See also

For pictures about the [i]concept[/i] of shotacon, see the tag [[pedophile]].

title: revy_(black_lagoon)
body:
[b]Revy[/b] is the female lead of [[Black Lagoon]] and the Lagoon Company's primary muscle. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[brown hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[black tank top]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and [[denim shorts|denim]] [[micro shorts]].

Known as "Two Hand" because of her penchant for [[dual wielding]] guns, she is the member of the company most likely to use violence to deal with problems and is very nihilistic and cynical, which often puts her at odds with the more idealistic [[Okajima Rokuro|Rock]]. Revy enjoys a good gunfight, and works with [[dutch_(black_lagoon)|Dutch]] because she gets to shoot people and get paid, though her violent tendencies often border on the psychotic at times. Her full name is Rebecca Lee.

title: florence_nightingale_(santa)_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. Archer-class version of [[Florence Nightingale (fate)|]], first seen as the welfare Santa Servant for the [[Nightingale no Christmas Carol|Christmas 2019 event]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Her [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]] is [[Assault Medicine]], a [[rifle]] [[umbrella gun|umbrella]] attached to a [[large syringe]] which shoots out medicine like bullets.

Her design is a reference to [[Mary Poppins (character)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takahashi Keitarou]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]

title: s.a.t.8_(maiden's_secret)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[S.A.T.8 (girls' frontline)|]]'s third skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'Night-time Stories of Summer Dreams' skin collection from 2019.

She wears a [[yellow kimono]] with [[pasta print|pasta]] and [[pizza print|pizza]] printed on it, a [[black sash|black]] [[obi]], [[black gloves]] and [[black sandals]], and her hair is up in [[twintails]] with [[orange ribbon|orange]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]]s. Her gun may have a [[cork]] in the muzzle and a [[price tag]] on the trigger.

title: s.a.t.8_(pumpkin_skewers)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[S.A.T.8 (girls' frontline)|]]'s second skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'Pumpkin Witch Festival' skin collection from 2018.

She wears a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with [[star print|star]]s and a [[moon print|moon]] [[print dress|printed]] over it, an [[open cardigan|open]] [[orange cardigan]], [[orange scrunchie|orange]] [[ankle scrunchie|ankle]] and [[hair scrunchie]]s, an [[orange sailor collar]] with a [[red neckerchief]], and [[pumpkin hair ornament]]s.

title: erdrick's_sword
body:
Legendary sword used by the hero Erdrick, and his descendants. Also known as Loto's Sword in Japanese.

It is once known as the Sword of Kings in [[Dragon Quest III]].

title: aisha_(last_origin)
body:
AKA GM Aisha, SmartJoy's Last Origin Community Manager and Game Master (GM). Since GM Aisha is intimately involved with the community, she is usually the one that receives the full brunt of hate and complaints from the community whenever SJ mess up. Be it with unpopular move/choice or just general spaghetti code madness. As such, it is common to see the character apologising.

The character comes in 3 flavours; a tired looking senior with polka dot panties AKA Aisha (Leader), a naive newbie who wears ribbon panties and has small spike at the end of her eyelashes AKA Aisha 48, and a fresh newbie who wears striped panties, has cat curvature on her top lip, and has a small spike in the middle of her eyelashes AKA Aisha 81.

Aisha is stronger than GM Orangeaid but is getting weaker every day.
other_names: アイシャ(ラストオリジン)

title: tmp_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[B&T MP9|Steyr TMP]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

When she was originally added to the game, her character description lines within the Index were bugged, replaced with the word "指挥官" (Commander) repeated over and over. Though hotfixed shortly after, this has resulted in some artists initially depicting her as yandere, though her character otherwise wouldn't suggest this.

In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], TMP appears as [[Harpsy (girls' frontline 2)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: shoujo_kakumei_utena
body:
